name: Strathlyn Coach House Barossa
description:
Please note there is a minimum stay of 2 nights.
Make use of the new Gymnasium and Guest Laundry on the property.
Enjoy the location set among the vineyards.
Conveniently close to the town of Angaston, cafes, restaurants, wineries and bike track.
neighborhood_overview: Strathlyn Estate is a very private property surrounded by extensive gardens. It is off the main road located amongst vineyards within walking distance of Saltram Winery. The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.
host_about: I have been a long time resident of the Barossa Valley.I would be happy to provide you with information about local points of interest.

name: Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa  Barossa
description:
Enjoy the charms of the Barossa Valley in this self contained cottage on the beautiful Strathlyn Estate located just out of Angaston.
If you are on an extended holiday, you have the convenience of a guest laundry on the property and a new Gymnasium.
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the tranquility of staying on the beautiful Strathlyn Estate, surrounded on all sides by historic vineyards.
Strathlyn Estate is within walking distance of Saltram Winery and the Farmers Market. The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.
host_about: I have been a long time resident of the Barossa Valley.I would be happy to provide you with information about local points of interest.

name: Shea-Oak Log Studio Shed
description:
Our converted shed is a cozy and comfortable one bedroomed studio with glossy kitchen, granite bench tops, timber floors, shiny bathroom and large carpeted bedroom with a comfy queen bed. The studio has everything you could possibly need to have a wonderful and comfortable stay.
Located in western Barossa, just off the Sturt Hwy, minutes away from Barossa attractions and 50 minutes from Adelaide. Be Consumed-In the Barossa.
neighborhood_overview: The Studio is located in a very unique area. There are no close by neighbouring houses, you are moments off of the Sturt Highway which leads you to the heart of the Barossa in 10 minutes and to Adelaide in 50 minutes. The studio is situated at the southern end of our property which is close to the Sturt Highway, this is great for access but you can hear the road noise from the studio. You are surrounded by the Barossa Ranges, vineyards and broadacre crops. No one will bother you here!
host_about:
We are a family of 4 who live, work and play in the Barossa Valley. We live on a small vineyard and make our own wine. We love the big outdoors, camping, the Murray river and doing things as a family. 
We are true locals and know the Barossa inside and out.
We live on the property but are far enough away to not bother you at all and let you enjoy yourselves but close enough if you have any problems.

name: Barossa Valley Apt 1 offers 2 bedrooms 2 bathroom
description:
Luxury apartment on offer right in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Tanunda. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms, FREE WIFI, full kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, access to laundry, own spa bath, double shower, 1 King bed which can split to 2 singles and 1 queen. Access to swimming pool. Let us tour you as well. Great location to walk to restaurants, cafes and some wineries.

We are also Tour Barossa so would love to help with all your wine touring needs, airport transfers and restaurant.
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Valley is a beautiful community of people.
host_about: love travel, love creating wonderful experiences, love wine, love food, love my 3 children

name: 2 bedrooms with Woodfire, Barossa Country Cottages
description: Relax as a couple, or with the whole family, at our peaceful cottage. Historic Lyndoch is the ideal place from which to experience the famous Barossa Valley.  The cottage is just a short 800 metres from the shops, bakery, and more. Restaurants and vineyards are within minutes. We supply free bicycles to explore the Barossa Cycling trails (Pre booking required). A second cottage is available on the site if you search airbnb for " 2 bedroom family cottage - sleeps up to 6 ".
host_about: Hi, We love hosting people at our cottages in the Barossa, both at the 1890s historic Barossa Hills Cottages in Springton, and these two bedroom family cottages at Lyndoch. In February 2022 the previous owners retired, and we have now refreshed the cottages - which are renowned throughout the Barossa as affordable family (& pet!) friendly accommodation.

name: Gawler River Farm B and B.
description:
The comfortable, stylish, large one bedroom apartment is situated on a working sheep farm. Enjoy country life, night stars, birds at dawn. 30 min. to the Barossa Valley, 60 min. Clare Valley, 40 min. Adelaide CBD.
10 min. Gawler Gliding club.
neighborhood_overview: The Gawler River area is the closest flat farming area to Adelaide. Studded with gum trees the farm land is park like. The view to the East is of the blue Mt Lofty ranges sweeping round to the Barossa Valley.
host_about:
My family have farmed in Gawler River since 1847. My farm runs the oldest Poll Dorset sheep stud in the world, I also grow cereal crops. Having lived in Gawler River all my live I have a detailed knowledge of the area, its history and attractions.
I enjoy traveling, meeting people and have many friends around the world. Especially through a long involvement with Rotary Youth Exchange.

name: The Miners Cottage Barossa Valley
description:
The Miners Cottage is beautifully restored with modern comforts and old world charm. Open fire, gorgeous bathroom, comfy bed, peace and quiet, sleeps two. The Miners Barn, right next to the cottage, can be added to your booking to sleep an extra two people. Beautiful views from every aspect.
A booking for four will be in two seperate cottages- two in the Miners Cottage and two in the Barn. They are right next to each other.
neighborhood_overview:
Set in rural surrounds on the edge of the Barossa, 7 mins to Lyndoch, 10 mins to Gawler, 15 mins to Tanunda, 30 mins to Angaston.

Tour the wineries, visit the farmers market, eat out, ride the Bike trail, fossick in an antique store...
host_about: Rebecca lives on the property with her husband and their 3 children.  They have a dog, cat, chooks, a duck and a few pet sheep.  Chances are you'll enjoy eggs fresh from the henhouse when you stay at The Miners Cottage!

name: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm
description:
If you long for a quiet retreat away from the crowds and close to nature, Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm could be for you. Perched on the hills above the North Para River in the south eastern ranges of the Barossa, you will be serenaded with the tweets from native birds, bleets from lambs and mesmerised by stunning sunrises and sunsets.
When the riches of local food and wine are needed, wineries, markets, cheese shops, cafe's and restaurants are just a 10 minute drive.
neighborhood_overview:
The beauty of Mt McKenzie is location.
Close to all the facilities that the Barossa Valley offers while giving privacy and independence of a rural property.

name: "The Shed"
description: At first glance, yes it's a shed. But explore further and you will find an unique Aussie experience, a fully functional self contained room. Shower, toilet and kitchenette. All private and seperate from our house. It's normally used for overnighters by family and friends. Please be open minded in your expectations, it's not the Ritz, Hilton, Taj Mahal but what it is clean, tidy, private affordable accomadation. Single or couple.
neighborhood_overview: Our residence is in a quiet street. We have lived at the same address for over 20yrs. We have a very safe neighbourhood and we have a good relationship with our neighbour's.
host_about:
My wife and I regard ourselves as very sociable people. I myself am an avid home brewer and love fine wine and social gatherings. Married since 1992 and have two teenage kids. Born and lived in the Barossa all my life with strong family ties and local knowledge. I work within the wine industry. Enjoy open air concerts, having been to numerous "Day On The Green" concerts. Love all types of music 80's to current day trends.
I have a favourite saying, 
"We are on this planet for a good time not a long time"

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury  Vineyard Cottage S Australia
description: Beautiful cottage facing vineyard.  French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included. Tennis court is available to all guests at our cottages.
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by lovely vineyards and wineries, kangaroos and beautiful birds.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the calmness of the country yet just an hour away from Adelaide. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate.
host_about: I am a Montessori teacher and at present working with children diagnosed with ASD. Love meeting people, friendly and easy going.

name: Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast
description:
Rustic double story self-contained stone cottage. Perfect for a romantic couple getaway. Centrally located within walking distance to Angaston, or a short drive to restaurants, cellar doors and all local attractions. This cottage offers the quirky, feeling of yesteryear, yet has modern conveniences to make your stay comfortable, welcoming and relaxing.
Your stay includes breakfast daily at a local cafe - Soul with Zest in Angaston.
Minimum 2 night booking is required.
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the historic town of Penrice, you can enjoy the picturesque walk or short drive to Angastons' cafe's, restaurants, pubs and shopping district.
host_about:
Welcome to Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast - Penrice, Barossa Valley
We are excited that you are planning a visit to the beautiful Barossa Valley
We would love to share our part of the Barossa with you and look forward to meeting you.

name: Little Para Cottage, Tanunda
description: Our  cottage is hidden away in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's little - just one cosy bedroom - but in a very handy location  just up the road from iconic Tanunda wineries. It has a private garden and undercover off-street parking.
neighborhood_overview: We are on the edge of town in a residential street that feels more rural than township. Houses are on one side, and wineries and few homes on large allotments are on the other side. We are on the winery side!
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity to relax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: Elderton Wines Guest House
description: Our Guest House is located in Nuriootpa, in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Situated a short walk from the Elderton Wines Cellar Door, this is a great base for any Barossa visit, be it wine tasting, cycling the Nuriootpa to Angaston bike track or indulging in one of the Barossa’s great eateries and restaurants. Continental breakfast provisions are provided. Also included for your stay – two bottles of Elderton wine which can be enjoyed in our Riedel glassware.
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the Barossa experience!

Elderton Guest House is ideally located within a short walking distance of:
Barossa Distillery
Provenance Barossa
Linke’s Central Meat Store – fifth generation butcher and smokehouse
Stein’s Tap House
Penfolds Cellar Door
Barossa Bush Gardens
Nuriootpa to Angaston Bike Trail
Barossa Farmers Market
Ember Pizza House
Barossa Co-Op Fresh Supermarket
Steiny’s Traditional Mettwurst
Vine Inn Barossa Community Hotel
Angas Park Hotel
Vintners Bar & Grill
Linke’s Bakehouse

The townships of Angaston & Tanunda are only a short 10 minute drive away.
host_about: Elderton Wines is a small, family-owned winery, situated in Nuriootpa, in the heart of Australia’s Barossa Valley. Established by Lorraine and Neil Ashmead in 1982 the winery is now managed by the second generation of the Ashmead family, brothers Cameron and Allister. The Ashmead family have enjoyed hosting many visitors over the years, and now offer Guest House accommodation to the public.

name: Cosy 2-bedroom Cottage in the heart of the Barossa
description: Lovely vineyard views as well as a convenient, central Barossa Valley location. Veritas Cottage is a recently renovated, fully self-contained cottage with loads of character. Guests have full access to this private home owned and operated by winemaker, Rolf Binder and partner, Cynthia. An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 65 acre property, yet with superb access to wineries, restaurants & shopping.
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. We’re now ‘semi-retired’ after selling our winery business in 2021, but our guests can still enjoy a special bottle of wine made by Rolf! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region. Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: The Sculptors Shed
description: Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley, surrounded by vineyard and just a stroll away from the Barossa Farmers Market.  This private room is separate to the main house, situated in the families back yard.  The Sculptors shed is a small, simple room with the basics on hand.  It is clean, warm, modern and comfortable all year round and a perfect place to base yourself in the Barossa. This room would ideally suit someone working in the Barossa looking for a short term stay.
neighborhood_overview: We are smack bang in the middle of the Barossa Valley on the Valley floor, a short stroll from the famous Barossa Farmers Market, that runs every Saturday morning, and walking distance to one of the Barossa's top restaurants, Vintners Bar and Grill.  We are also very close to the bike track that will take you into Angaston, Nuriootpa and now all they way to Lyndoch.  Hundreds of cellar doors and resturants are also close by. Angaston is approximately 3kms away, as is Nuriootpa where there is a large supermarket and other facilities.
host_about: Food and wine lovers that love being surrounded by family and friends and meeting new people

name: Vineyard Cottage - Under the Vines
description:
Under the Vines is a self contained cottage in five acres of vineyard and native bushland, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region.

Every window has a vineyard view!

(This accommodation is also available with 2 bathrooms)
neighborhood_overview:
Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself!

The Barossa Valley offers many unique and rich experiences - food, wine, culture, heritage. Allow time to immerse yourself in some of these....and then come back again for another bite!

name: Barossa Idyll Studio -great for romantics
description: Barossa Idyll  Studio is located in the centre of the Barossa in Tanunda a short walk to cafes, wine bars and restaurants. A small and cosy haven; the Studio is attached to Barossa Idyll. With beautiful lawns and gardens, this is set in amongst magnificent Barossa vineyard and hills views.
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Idyll is located in the centre of the Barossa in the main street of Tanunda. There are  cafes , hotels and restaurants within in a few minutes walking distance . There are many wineries a short drive away. The Barossa Visitor Centre is also located in Tanunda.
host_about: Our family has had many wonderful experiences travelling in other countries and I would love to share the experience of our regions with you. Living between the vineyards and the coast we are able to share the lifestyle of both with our guests.

name: Barossa Idyll -centre of town, breathtaking views
description:
Located only a short walk to restaurants, wine bars and cafes. Architecturally designed for light and space; Barossa Idyll is warm and appealing with a true sense of conviviality.
Well suited to groups; five bedrooms , three bathrooms, two lounges with open fires. Indulge in evening drinks on the lawns or firepit, immerse yourself in the view overlooking the vineyards below.
Everything you need for a perfect Barossa stay. Mid week stay rates available.
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Idyll is located in the centre of the Barossa in the main street of Tanunda. name: Historic Kapunda School of Mines Homestay
description:
This delightful 1860s two-story building is a centrepiece in copper mining history. It not only provides a depth of incredible history, but it is also a very comfortable place to rest your head when visiting Kapunda and the surrounding areas such as the Barossa and Clare Valleys.

The Kapunda school of mines residence has spacious rooms, lofty ceilings, character and charm combined with luxury and convenience. Two double bedrooms can sleep up to 4 people very comfortably.
neighborhood_overview: Kapunda is a delightful historic country town with plenty to see.  There is something for everyone.

name: The Stables
neighborhood_overview: There’s plenty to do, only minutes away: Tanunda Pines Golf course, the bike/walking path (from Angaston to Gawler) runs past the top of our property, hot air ballooning, helicopter scenic flights, wineries, restaurants, art galleries, cafes and day spa (at the Novotel). What more could you want?
host_about:
A Barossa girl, I started my nursing at Angaston Hospital, played netball for Sandy Creek and Lyndoch clubs, was a tour guide for Orlando and, the then, Kaiser Stuhl wineries and also a wine rep for Tolleys; so I do appreciate Barossa wines and just love this area.

After many years living both interstate and overseas the magic of the Barossa Valley always draws you back!

Gardening, animals, people, fine wine and food are a few of my passions.

name: The Lodge Angaston
description:
Welcome to Angaston, Crown of the world renown Barossa wine region. Experience one of SA's most unique & grand designed buildings framed by 100 yo Moreton Bay fig trees. The Lodge towers prominently above Murray St and oh so conveniently located within minutes to award winning local cafes, shops & restaurants.
The lodge is well situated to access walking - cycling paths while road/mountain bike riders will delight in the local routes.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston, 'the Crown of the Barossa' is nestled in the Barossa Ranges. You will need to set aside a couple of days to walk and taste and experience all the Main Street and historic surrounds have to offer.  Welcome to country hospitality.
host_about:
Hi. Thank you reading some of my bio.
Sharing a love of travel and discovery awarded me the opportunity to call the township of Angaston my Barossa home, my life and my passion. 
I would love nothing more than to welcome you and share some of my favourite authentically Barossa things to do.
Whether it's exploring a winery or two. Purely for research purposes of course. Taking in the local markets, catching up with friends while sourcing some locally grown produce to accompany our world class wines.  Walking or jogging and taking in the serenity of the every changing seasonal countryside. And sometimes sharing that space with wild kangaroos is majestic. 
You may even find me in a quaint little winter sunny spot or curled up with a good read in front of the fire.
The yang side of my personality loves nothing more than changing up the pace a bit.  Pop on some bright lippy,  jump on a scoot'ntoot scooter while getting some Barossa wind on my face.
I enjoy attempting all manner of sports and outdoor activities. Learning some footy skills from the local teens or switching up to my summer pace, water skiing & wake boarding.
I love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. 
My latest interest is self sustainability and environmentally sustainable practices. 
My mantra carpe diem. 
I can't wait to greet you and share a little of my Barossa home.

We can also offer our wine touring services to show your our amazing Barossa region. Airport and restaurant transfers

name: Historic Angaston Masonic Lodge
description: Hello & welcome to Angaston (Crown of the Barossa) & home to one of South Australia's most prized architectural listing. The 147yo lodge is located within walking distance to everything Angaston. Local cafes, restaurants, award winning produce, wineries, bikeways/walkways, historical points of interest & surrounded by beautiful scenery. Affordable luxury.
neighborhood_overview: Put simply, friendly country hospitality.  We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to our township and world class Barossa region. You will love the culture, history and regional diversity. Our community is safe, walking the streets isn't a worry, please consider, not all roads are well lit. we can provide you with a torch or download a torch to your mobile phone.

name: The Cottage at Riverside Farm
description: A beautiful, secluded, self contained cottage in the Barossa Valley overlooking the North Para River. There are many places to walk, picnic or simply enjoy the view. All modern amenities included and sleeps up to 4 people. A couple of minutes away from Chateau Yaldara, the Lyndoch Hill Restaurant and the Lyndoch main street. Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.

name: Barossa Millhouse
description: The Barossa Millhouse is a charming older style stone cottage in a spacious garden setting. It welcomes with polished floorboards, natural light, original paintings by local artists and comfy slightly vintage furniture. Ducted air-con for temperature control, a claw foot bath to languish in & cosy quilts.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is full of wonderful old stone buildings , is great for walks, and peaceful. The main street has everything you need.  Kapunda is close to everything .
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm an artist and business owner living  in the Barossa Valley. I love characterful houses, homes and hospitality and I have  three accommodations available in South Australia.
I have a weakness for beautiful stone homes typical to South Australia, that have a European feel. I appreciate natural light, wooden floorboards, enhancing architectural features and preserving what works from the past whilst adding charm and modern comforts. I like my guests to feel they have a stylish home away from home. 
My renovations style is comfy French provincial with a touch of vintage and original artworks on the walls for a restful and inspiring stay.
I travel a lot myself so I appreciate what it is to arrive to a place that feels like you can kick your shoes off, pour a wine and relax.

name: A Barn in the Barossa
description:
A Barn in the Barossa is a 2 storey picture book bluestone home architecturally renovated to celebrate wood, stone & natural light. It’s been featured by Qantas and other magazines. A one hour drive from Adelaide central and 12 minutes from famous Barossa Cellar doors. The ClareValley and Auburn are within range at 40 minute drive.

Guests love the unique experience of the barn with beautiful spaces to relax and unwind. They are always delighted. The peace and starry nights are superb.
neighborhood_overview:
The barn is 18 minutes to Maggie Beers Farm shop and The Eatery ( a very delicious dining experience featuring local produce and shared plates style ) & 24 minutes to the Barossa Farmers Markets and all that ANGASTON and Vintners restaurant . Take in the sculpture park lookout with stunning views across the Barossa.

Explore the Kaiser Stuhl national park where you can see kangaroos if you keep your eyes peeled and tread softly.
Yalumba winery and many boutiques wines are great to visit in the area.

Tanunda is 30 minutes drive from the barn and has boutique shopping, more wineries, cafes restaurants and art galleries.

Local amenities, pubs, supermarket, park for the kids and landscaped duck pond, and country bakery.

The barn is a solid 1860s structure which has been converted with the help of an architect and a local builder to a very comfortable home and spacious living.

The barn is located on the edge of the charming

name: Angaston by the Winter Creek
description:
Two storey log cabin style home nestled amongst a cottage garden and well established privacy trees. Imagine sitting on the front porch with a cuppa watching the birds and listening to the meandering winter creek.
A perfect backdrop for your wedding or commitment ceremony.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is defined as the Crown of the Barossa nestled amongst the foothills. Country hospitality, beautiful scenery, culture, ample free open public spaces, walking tracks and push bike tracks coupled with the necessities, cafes, cheese shop, award winning butcher/small goods, restaurants, wine bars and of course, the world famous Barossa cellar doors. Why not consider hiring a scooter and capture you entire days experience on the go pro. We can load your day's captured experience onto the usb stick. Check us out on the (EMAIL HIDDEN)

name: Retro Barossa Style
description:
A lovely fully renovated 1950's house in the heart of Angaston. Experience the Barossa like a local. A short walk to the main street and less than 10 minutes drive to Tanunda. Drop into a winery, enjoy a balloon ride across the Barossa or just kick back enjoy the pace of life.
Please note a booking for two guests will allow access to one bedroom in the house. If you require both bedrooms you must book for a minimum of three guests. All guests must be over 18.
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful town in the heart of the Barossa, Angaston is nestled in the rolling hills away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A great place to unwind and just enjoy the local places to dine or take a walk around the streets soaking up the feel of the Barossa.
host_about: I am a winemaker/distiller who has spent many years travelling and living overseas. I love the idea of living like a local when I travel and hope that my experience of being a traveller and a regular user of Airbnb as a guest will help create a wonderful experience for others.

name: Barossa Vineyard Cottages
description:
Situated in Bethany, our fully self-contained stone cottages are located in the heart of the Barossa Valley.
Bordered by vineyards and a stunning outlook to the Barossa Ranges, the area is steeped in history and boasts of great walks as well as being surrounded by award winning wineries and restaurants.
With modern comforts behind classic settler style and grace, our cottages remain comfortable in every season.

description: The perfect getaway. A uniquely secluded, air conditioned, bed and breakfast cottage in a romantic setting, exclusively for two. Vistas over looking rolling hills and vineyards from the paved terrace. A country charmed garden, a self cook full breakfast and a two person therapeutic spa.
neighborhood_overview:
Secluded country cottage. Shops and restaurants are within a comfortable driving distance. This is a great location to launch your self drive tour of the Barossa.
If you are traveling here for the first time or would like some new ideas - We are more than happy to help with additional information and suggestions on restaurants, wineries, places of interest, walking trails and more.
host_about: We enjoy travel and enjoy knowing what you love about travel too. We love getting to see something more of each local region. By meeting locals and travellers we enjoy sharing stories, finding and creating something special together.

name: Lambert Estate Retreat
description:
You’ll love the house because of Just 3 minutes’ drive from the heart of the Barossa Valley wine region (Angaston). It is 9 minutes’ drive from the Barossa Farmers Market and 20 minutes’ drive from The Barossa Valley Golf Club
Located in the Lambert Estate Winery, the house looks down the beautiful vineyard. Enjoy your day relaxing in the yard and having the kangaroos as your traveling companions
The entire house is good for couples, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups
host_about: The Barossa Valley is renowned wine-producing region northeast of Adelaide. If you are a wine lover, this is the destination you must visit. However, the Barossa has much more to offer than wine, please come and experience it.  Lambert estate retreat is part of Lambert Estate and it has been welcoming guests since 2013. We try our best to offer you the home-feeling accommodation.

name: Lemke Cottage,Moculta, Barossa Valley
description:
Our place is ideal for couples and business travellers. It has been our home away from home for 26 years. We have furnished it with locally made antique furniture. Jan has the largest collection of wire ware in Australia and guests will see these items displayed in the kitchen and throughout the cottage. The cottage is fully equipped with TV and free Wi Fi.
Guests are provided with a light breakfast with a selection of cereals, bread for toast, a selection of condiments and tea or coffee.
neighborhood_overview: Moculta is a quiet little hamlet of about 280 residents. It is served by two Lutheran churches, Gruenberg and Gnadenberg.  Both are historic and worth visiting.  A visit to the Barossa wouldn't be complete without a visit to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company to purchase some locally made cheese and crackers to go with your favourite wine.There are a number of wineries a short drive away, with Henschke Hill of Grace Winery and vineyard the closest. There is an information book with our selection of favourite  take away and restaurants for the information of guests.
host_about: John and Jan Shepherd have owned Lemke Cottage for 26 years.  Both have lead professional lives and have used the cottage as a weekend escape during this time. They have travelled extensively and stayed in B and B's rather than hotels and motels.  They decided to share their unique cottage with others and offer it as an Air BnB. They both enjoy overseas travel but also have travelled extensively throughout Australia.  John now runs a consultancy helping businesses grow, and Jan keeps busy with volunteering as a Justice of the Peace, Folk Dancing and Tai Chi.  They both enjoy music and regularly attend Adelaide Symphony Orchestra Concerts. They have 9 grandchildren and enjoy time with their family.

name: Casa Rossa - modern Barossa home with vineyard
description: A hidden paradise in the heart of the Barossa, with everything you need for a peaceful family-friendly getaway. It is the perfect home base for exploring the Barossa Valley and making the most of your stay, whether you're an outdoors type, a wine connoisseur or just simply here to unwind. Then spend your evenings looking out onto its private vineyard and drinking in the sights and smells of nature at your doorstep, or cozy up by the log fire with a glass of wine
neighborhood_overview:
Casa Rossa is located in Lyndoch, South Australia, Australia.

Lyndoch is a small but thriving town in the heart of the Barossa Valley, and is growing and improving constantly. From the property, it is about a twenty minute scenic walk into town, or a speedy five minute drive.

You should be able to stock up on most things in Lyndoch, especially if you are in need of a quick fix. There is an IGA and convenience store, hairdresser and beautician, pub, and a number of great restaurants and cafes. Make sure you get to the Lord Lyndoch bistro for dinner!

For bigger shops, head to Gawler, about a ten minute drive from the property, which has a shopping mall and main street strip with Coles, Foodland, Big W, Target etc, as well as a number of boutiques and specialty stores.

Local attractions and venues include cellar doors and art Galleries.
Hot air-ballooning
Helicopter Scenic flights
Lord Lyndoch Restaurant
Lavender farm

name: Barossa Valley Farm Cottage - Buckbury End Farm
description:
BUCKBURY END FARM - Est. 1895
Peace and quiet in a private freshly renovated stone cottage, Come and enjoy the pure serenity it has to offer.

Buckbury End Farm is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and is minutes to some fabulous wineries. It is a perfect base for your wine adventure.

The North Para river meanders it's way through and creates a spectacular backdrop continually changing with each season.

Other local attractions include the Whispering Wall, Lavender Farm &Jacobs Creek.

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Cottage. Luxury & Privacy.
description:
Set amongst vineyards and tranquil gardens, exclusive luxury for one couple, perfect for unwinding or celebrating any special occasion.
Luxury facilities & amenities, plentiful provisions, peace, quiet, fresh air and privacy - relax and indulge!
Great location, walking distance to Hentley Farm and Fino, Seppeltsfield. Close to Appellation, Barossa Valley Estate and Izway Wines, so much to see and do. We love sharing our local knowledge and helping with recommendations during your stay!
neighborhood_overview:
We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are right next door to Hentley Farm (you can walk there on our private path)
Surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants FINO, Appellation and Hentley Farm and it's also a short walk to the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and other unique experiences, but also the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker and potter. You can even book to make your own knife (but plan and book well ahead!) You will also find Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products & Octeine Coffee & Cafe.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm, Barossa V
host_about: Introducing people to all of the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what we love to do.  We love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowledge and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region.

name: Indulge and Relax Tanunda
description:
Comfortable, modern cottage within 5-10 minute walk of the centre of Tanunda. Perfect base for touring wineries, easy walk from FermentAsian Restaurant, 1918 bistro, as well as cafes, bakeries and supermarket of central Tanunda.

Full modern kitchen and bathroom, peaceful garden with several relaxing areas to sip a glass of wine, chat or read.
neighborhood_overview:
Most cellar doors in the Barossa Valley are open 7 days for free wine tastings, mostly 10am or 11am until 4pm or 5pm (no booking required).

Eating at local restaurants, especially FermentAsian and 1918 (both walking distance from the house) may require a booking in advance and are thoroughly recommended

Tanunda Foodland Supermarket 5-10 minute walk or easy drive away.

name: The Stables at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
description:
This old stone building has been in use since the 1860s, including as crop storage, machinery shed and stables.
Now it’s been reimagined into a secluded hideaway for two with the perfect ingredients for pure luxury. There’s more of everything in The Stables – set on its own 500m2 block away from the other cottages, it includes a large living space, a spacious entertaining deck, private garden, high ceilings, cathedral skylights, extra large spa bath and log fire to cuddle up next to.

description:
Luxury 2 storey home in the heart of the Barossa Valley with pool table and antique baby grand piano.

A small park borders the home on 2 sides with room to play cricket, football or soccer!

Prepare your own meals in the fully equipped kitchen or take short stroll to the Weintal for breakfast, lunch or dinner, or dine out at anyone of the famous Barossa restaurants.

name: The Writer's Studio, Barossa
description:
Perfect for one or two people, The Writer's Studio is fully self-contained.
It has a really comfortable and firm inflatable queen bed.
Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard.
This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer.
It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary. Or we can set up another inflatable bed in the loft, accessed by a loft ladder.
neighborhood_overview: There is a vineyard and winery cellar door directly opposite the house.  It is a short, two block walk to the main street, supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, restaurants, Information Centre and bicycle hire.
host_about:
I am a full time business coach helping business owners create businesses that work for not because of them.  My clients are mainly in Australia, New Zealand and the US, and as long as time zones are compatible I can work with them from anywhere. Thanks to Skype I have conducted my client meetings from Jaipur (India), New York, Perth, Sydney, South Australia and San Diego.
Clearly - one of the  things I can't live without is travel.
And I can't live without my Kindle - which has lightened my travel load enormously. No more books to carry and leave as I pick up more.
I love great food and wine - I live in a wine region where the two go together.
I am a great guest. Quiet, fun, a reader and a walker.
My life motto is Stride Into Life.

name: Martinsell Cottage Barossa Valley
description:
A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables.

The cottage is set on the estate 500m from one of SA's most significant Georgian manors, 'Martinsell', built in 1901.
This is also available for accomodation of up to four guests please log in to Martinsell Manor for further details.https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387
neighborhood_overview:
The Pewsey Vale area was settled by English, Scottish and German settlers. Pewsey Vale is a part of the world-famous Barossa Valley food and wine region, famous for bold red wines, delicate Pewsey Vale Rieslings, and the finest boutique foods.

The Barossa and its surroundings offer a wide variety of activities from hot air ballooning to trekking, cycling, horse riding, fishing, kayaking, wine tasting and more.

Closest large stores:
Gawler (25min drive / 20km nth west) has a many large town facilities and services including;
•Supermarket open until 9pm mon-sat
•24 hr petrol station

The local town of Williamstown (10min drive / 10km west) has a small general store, cemist, hotel, and bakery etc.
We are close to the National Motor Museum in Birdwood 18km, the famous Collingrove hillclimb circuit, and some of the best driving roads in Australia, through the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Ranges.

A Barossa Valley information guide
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.
neighbourhood: Pewsey Vale, Barrossa Valley , South Australia, Australia

name: Historic home on 65 acres in top Barossa location
description:
Premium self-contained accommodation in a fantastic central location. Hanisch Haus is a recently renovated home built in 1907. Guests have full access to the entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.
An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility of the property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. Full breakfast provisions are included with a bottle of wine, made by Rolf.
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. We’re now ‘semi-retired’ after selling our winery business in 2021, but our guests can still enjoy a special bottle of wine made by Rolf! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region. Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: Hill House Angaston
description:
Hill House offers unique accommodation in the Barossa Valley, South Australia's world renowned wine region, overlooking the picturesque township of Angaston.

Stay in 1851 the original 2-room cottage part of this outstanding historic country mansion. Ideal for couples, 1851 is a beautifully appointed suite with private access. Take advantage of the many wineries, cellar doors and award winning restaurants nearby.

name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent - privacy, luxury, nature
description: Boongarrie Luxury Tent  offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment.  Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different.
neighborhood_overview: Flaxman Valley is a quiet regional area with some small wineries ,farms , pottery and a great place to brings bikes.
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

name: Miriam's Cottage self contained Bed and Breakfast
description:
This lovely 1920's cottage is located in a quiet tree lined street in the heart of Tanunda.
Miriam's is a 5 minute walk to shops and restaurants such as Ferment Asian, 1918, Musque and cafe's. Also walking distance to Langmeil winery, Peter Lehmann, Z Wines etc
Breakfast provisions are there for guests to either have a cooked breakfast of bacon, eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms or continental breakfast.
Included is also a cheese plate and bottle of wine.
Firepit only supplied when seasonal.
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is in the heart of the Barossa and is close to all facilities. Miriam's Cottage is in a very quiet street but very close to everything. Walking distance to shops, restaurants, park, bakery

name: Azalea Cedar-Rose Barossa Vineyard Views Villa
description:
Azalea Cedar-Rose has been uniquely refurbished while maintaining its period charm and is perfectly situated to explore Australia's premier wine region, the Barossa Valley.

Boasting 4 spacious and stunning queen size bedrooms, accommodating up to 11.

Two bathrooms, spa bath, bathrobes, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi

The villa is alluring, beds made, fire set, afternoon tea supplied and beautiful vineyard views

Complimentary port and chocolates.
neighborhood_overview:
Easy stroll to bakeries, cafes, restaurants, pubs, super-market, fashion shops, cellar doors and art Galleries.
Hot air-ballooning
Helicopter Scenic flights
Lord Lyndoch Restaurant
Lavender farm
Excellent Tourist office in Tanunda
host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.

name: Your complete Barossa experience for up to 16
description:
Our four modern and stylish apartments are located right in the heart of the Barossa Valley - Tanunda. You will have the luxury and personal use of all apartments when you stay.
Each apartment has access to complimentary Wi-Fi, large screen TV's, spa, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen a facilities, coffee machine, lounge / dining area. Air-conditioning in all rooms. Use of outdoor pool area ideal in the summer time. 2 night min. most weekends.
neighborhood_overview: Our property is located in a wonderful community and we respect the homes surrounding us, so need to keep the noise level at a minimum please. The swimming pool area is not to be used after dark.

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
description:
The Reserve sits on six acres and accommodates up to 10 people in five bedrooms. It has an open plan fully equipped kitchen for food lovers, three bathrooms, several living and dining areas.
There are magnificent views and a huge outdoor area with a wood fired pizza oven.
The Reserve Barossa Valley is an amazing place to .... escape, relax and indulge all the Barossa has to offer
neighborhood_overview:
Where are the best Barossa Cellar Doors? Well, many of them can be found along Seppeltsfield Road! These include Hentley Farm, 2015 James Halliday Wine Companion Cellar Door of the Year. Hentley Farm, Greenock Creek Wines,Tscharke’s Place, Izway, Rolf Binder, Heritage, Two Hands and Torbreck are just a few of the wineries along the nine kilometres of Seppeltsfield Road where premium Barossa wines, including many famous Barossa Shiraz wines (the variety the Barossa is most famous for) can be tasted. Whistler Wines is a fabulous spot to combine wine tasting with a platter in the gardens under a gum tree, then visit their rescued pet kangaroos! Many of the wines produced in the Marananga/Seppeltsfield/Greenock sub-region of the Barossa are world class.

We have small, single vineyard producers without cellar doors as well as iconic establishments including the historic Seppeltsfield Estate Winery founded in 1851 and Winner of the 2016 Qantas National Tourism Award for Best Tour
host_about:
There’s something very special about the Barossa. You can feel it in the landscape, in the people, the food and the wine. It’s a beautiful region, with villages, vineyards and farms dotting a patchwork vista. Barossans are famous for their generous hospitality, their love of a shared table and their passion for local food and wine. Festivals, celebrations, markets and music thrive here. Barossa is life’s great pleasures, in one unique place. 

We welcome you to Barossa. The place we love. The place we call home.

name: Pinecone Ridge, Barossa - enjoy your own 16 acres
description:
Whether you are looking for a base from which to explore the Barossa, or a place in which to bunker down and take a break from a fast-paced life, Pinecone Ridge is for you.

The house is nestled into a ridge top amongst rolling hills and vineyards, and large windows in the open plan living area allow you to enjoy the spectacular views whether you are inside or outside.

Enjoy exploring the 16 acre property - it's all yours!
neighborhood_overview:
Pinecone Ridge is 2km from the main street of Angaston.

Angaston is arguably the prettiest of the towns in the Barossa. Set amongst rolling hills it offers a well-preserved heritage streetscape lined by large leafy trees. It also sits on the border of the Barossa & Eden Valleys making a perfect base from which to explore both wine regions. It is home to the Barossa Cheese Company, Yalumba, Vitners restaurant, and the not-to-be-missed Barossa Farmers Market amongst many other attractions.
host_about:
Hi! 

Pinecone Ridge is really a family project - we are all involved: Anne, Josh, Jeb, April & Isla.

We purchased the property in Nov 2017 as a family escape & renovation project. The property had previously been owned by a 92 year old gentleman with poor eyesight & needed lots of attention but we could see the potential & loved the views & location.

Running Pinecone Ridge is a family affair. April creates the welcome signs. Isla collects the pinecones. Jeb is Josh’s right hand man when it comes to maintenance. I get the privilege of escaping to the Barossa every week to clean & prep & often Josh is able to join me. In school holidays the kids help too. And we have all contributed to the eclectic styling of the home!

We have created Pinecone Ridge to be our family getaway - cosy, comfortable, fun, creative, peaceful, surrounded by nature - a place in which to clear the head & relax into a slower pace of life, yet also close to the action & deliciousness of the Barossa. We love sharing it with you and reading your reviews together. May you have a wonderful stay!

Anne

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery House..Get it all!
description: Historic Lyndoch,  is less than 1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD. Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable private house with all amenities, in this unique 1850’s colonial building. Price is for 2 guests (no extra cleaning fee). Additional guests (including children) are $25/person/night. Baby amenities for hire if required (portacot/high chair etc). Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby.
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the ‘Gateway’ to the Barossa Valley. The residence gives you local ambience and history, whilst providing you the opportunity to explore this vibrant tourist wine & food region. Tanunda, Nuriootpa, Angaston and other Barossa Valley towns are all an easy drive away. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the B&B.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

name: Linfield Cottage
description: Linfield Cottage is a beautifully restored 1900 Federation Home on the edge of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills. Fully equipped and situated on our stunning 19 hectares of vineyard from which we produce our own wines, it's the perfect base to explore the hundreds of wineries within both regions, or the plethora of scenic walking tracks. When you've finished sightseeing, relax on the property and enjoy the stunning views, soak in the spa and sip on our hand-crafted, single vineyard wines.
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is situated on the family property, 19 hectares of Linfield Road Wines Vineyard. We're just half a kilometre up the road should you need anything.
host_about:
We live and work on our beautiful vineyard property. We love cooking and enjoying a bottle of our wine overlooking the property. 
Travelling is always on the list of things to do when we have downtime. 
Reading is a great passion in our family and our choices wide and varied.

name: WHISTLER VINEYARD RETREAT
description: Set on 80acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley this private, self-contained guest wing is surrounded by vineyard and gardens. Our retreat gets you back to nature... with vineyard and scrub walks, (accompanied by at least one of our Border Collies), friendly geese, an inquisitive free-roaming peacock, hens, rescued & wild kangaroos, the occasional Koala and a myriad of birdlife. Take in the views from the verandas, sit by the campfire (during the cooler months) or relax in the hammock.
neighborhood_overview: Our Retreat is on the most scenic road in the Barossa with 15 wineries to discover, including the historic Seppeltsfield Winery. An exciting new addition, within walking distance, is the new Seppeltsfield Road Distillers where you can enjoy handcrafted gin on their stunning deck. We have world-class restaurants within a 5 minute drive - Appellation, Fino and Hentley Farm. Our neighbours are the famous Maggie Beer Farmshop and Eatery. The work of top SA artists can be seen at the JamFactory gallery and artisan workshops. Other coffee shops, galleries and excellent shopping can be found at the 3 main towns, all within 5km from our home. The first stage of the new Seppeltsfield Road  shared path trail runs through our property. The Barossa also has other bike trails.
host_about: I'm a born and bred, proud Barossan. Married to Martin for 48 years we have 3 adult children and 8 grandchildren. 30 years of teaching has kept me young at heart. I love meeting people through our family winery and I'm very involved in the local community. I'm known as 'the Green Queen', somewhat obsessed with  recycling and caring for the environment. I'm an animal and nature-lover, loving life on our beautiful property and happy to share it with others.

name: The Barn - a little bit rustic, a little bit luxe
description: Step into a little bit of rustic charm with some luxe comfort at the Barn - it shares some nuances of glamping - but not in a tent!   Nestled on our 5-acre property named Pondicherri, The Barn is set amongst a collection of historic outbuildings offering a countryside escape in a village atmosphere and yet, is very close to all what the Barossa Valley can offer.  From the Barn you will see no neighbours, no street lights and a huge night sky of twinkling stars.
neighborhood_overview:
Just a short 3km drive away from Pondicherri, lies the historic village of Angaston. It boasts a diverse range of cafes, restaurants, two pubs, a supermarket, butcher, hardware, medical centre, post office, and speciality Barossa food businesses - offering something for everyone. The Barossa Farmer's Market is also only a stone's throw away and can be easily accessed by taking the dirt Saleyards Road. However, be wary of kangaroos that tend to frequent the vineyards.

The region is home to many high-quality wineries, restaurants, food establishments, and historic buildings that are just minutes away from Pondicherri. For those who prefer outdoor activities, there are numerous walking and cycling trails, as well as easy bushwalks - perfect for spotting kangaroos at Kaisersthul Conservation Park. For a bird's eye view of the region, try hot air ballooning or a helicopter ride. The options are endless, except for surfing!

If you're looking to venture further out, the
host_about: Greetings, and a warm welcome to Pondicherri - and The Barn.  I’m a host, self-employed, creator of images,  an adventurous traveller,  have an organic orchard, adore my little pets, love cooking and adore  the smell of a freshly picked lemon.

name: Woodland Cottage
description: Set between the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills wine districts with many wonderful wineries within easy reach, this European style log cottage on 20 tranquil acres allows you to see abundant wildlife and native plants - kangaroos, birds, ground orchids. 1km walking track on property, through natural bush settings. Other walking tracks in adjacent Mt Crawford Forest. Nearby towns of Birdwood and Mt Pleasant offer hotel meals, coffee shops and bakeries. Perfect place for a real Aussie experience.
neighborhood_overview: Birdwood houses the National Motor Museum, worth a visit for motoring enthusiasts. As well as wonderful wineries and restaurants throughout the region, there are other hidden gems such as the Applewood gin distillery in nearby Gumeracha and a fabulous local market on Saturdays at Mt Pleasant.
host_about: Love living on our peaceful 20 acres of Australian bushland between the Barossa  and the Adelaide Hills wine regions. Happily married. Love dogs, bushwalks, Australian native orchids, willdlife, good wine. Love travelling, especially to Europe. My wife and I will try our best to give you a tranquil, comfortable Australian country experience.

name: The Dairyman Barossa .. The Chaff House
description:
Exclusive self-contained Farm Accommodation set in the foothills of the Barossa Ranges. A fusion of heritage, functional architecture & edgy style, located between Lyndoch & Williamstown in the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Take in the stunning views from every direction – vineyards, rolling hills & farm life.

Enjoy an abundance of traditional breakfast provisions straight from the farm.

Google for more information...thedairymanbarossa
neighborhood_overview: We are 5-15 minutes from regional towns and many cellar doors close by
host_about:
The saying is true: the grass is greener on the other side, especially as you cross the paddock and unlatch the galvanised farm gate at The Dairyman’s Cottage entrance. This is Barossa country chic at its finest with a clean style that is as comfortable as it is design savvy. 

This reinvented getaway dates back to the 1840s. Stretch out in the Chaff House, a workshop where grain was once crushed, or hole up in the Dairyman’s Cottage for a stay that shares a similarly unique past, operating more recently to milk cows. Both pads now make up a relaxed and unpretentious Barossa getaway and can be booked in conjunction with one another or as separate retreats. 

Guests can quite literally wake up and smell the bacon, thanks to a healthy spread of breakfast provisions and other fresh produce that come directly from paddock to plate. And although your Barossa itinerary is likely to be teeming with sojourns to cellar doors and eateries, it's hard to overlook the peace that lazing in the shade of the South Australian sun brings. Take in the rich pastures and surrounding panoramas of the grape-dotted Barossa Valley Ranges, by spending the evenings on the paved terrace with your feet up, sipping a glass of something smooth from neighbouring vineyards. 

It's instinctual to wander the working dairy facility, so why not introduce yourself to the residents on an afternoon farm walk and feed the heritage breed free-range pigs. And if there are any items you can no longer live without when back home, The Dairyman has an online shop to keep you stocked up on breakfast packs and more.

description: Beautiful villa facing vineyard.  French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park on our estate. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Surrounded by lovely vineyards and wineries, kangaroos and beautiful birds.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the calmness of the country yet just an hour away from Adelaide. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate.
host_about: I am a Montessori teacher and at present working with children diagnosed with ASD. Love meeting people, friendly and easy going.

name: Fechner Place★Barossa Studio★ 1 Bed★Breakfast★Wine
description: The Fechner Place guest suite is located only minutes from some of the Barossa Valley's finest restaurants  and Cellar Doors, and only a 15 min walk to Tanunda's main street. There are many restaurants and Cellar doors within a 25 minute stroll.
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is located on a lovely quiet street, with its own private entrance and parking. Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for easy access to many of the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.

We are a 2 min drive from the pretty village of Tanunda that is well serviced with a varied selection of cafes, restaurants, pubs, 2 breweries, supermarket, butcher, bakeries, specialty retail stores, a medical centre, hospital and post office for your convenience.

We are a short 10 min drive to the famed Barossa Valley Farmers market in the picturesque township of Angaston, which is open on Saturday mornings from 7.30am. This is on our must do list.

If food and wine are not your thing, there are numerous walking and cycling trails with some easy bush walks through Kaiser Stuhl National Park. This is best visited at dusk to do som
host_about:
I've lived with my partner and 3 gorgeous children in the Beautiful Barossa Valley, South Australia for over 40 years. We enjoy spending time outdoors with our family on our 30 acre property.
We have both worked in the wine and Tourism Industry for the last 20 years and understand the importance of great guest experiences. We have travelled extensively and experienced all types of accommodation.  I have been able to use what I have learnt to create a very successful Airbnb business (Your Home Anywhere).
I have a keen interest and passion in real estate and travel and now enjoy combining both by hosting properties through Airbnb. We love creating beautiful, comfortable spaces that our guests can call "home" and pride ourselves in offering a 5 star service. Our aim is that our guests never want to leave!
Guests can contact Karina at Your Home Anywhere on: 0422 390 791

name: Barossa Valley Studio
description:
Situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley within the beautiful township of Angaston. Our Self Contained Studio gives your privacy with views of Angastons Hills. The Studio has it's own Kitchenette, ensuite bathroom and a small bunk bed room for two kids*. On the exterior guests have full use of the guest BBQ.

We are located a short 800m walk along a the beautiful trail into Angaston township. Nearby are many restaurants, cafes, wineries.

*Note lower bunk is rated to 120kg and upper 80kg
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a beautiful picturesque town located in the Barossa Valley. Within the town there are services such as a butcher, supermarket, pubs, cafes,  restaurants, barossa cheese company and many more other attractions.
host_about: I am married to my beautiful wife and live in the stunning barossa valley. While working in the wine industry we also host our studio through airbnb. I love to travel, having been to around 40 countries and all 6 continents (not antartica). The experiences travelling brings is second to none, food, culture, adventure, architecture. From travelling we have stayed in a mix bag of accommodations, local homestay, villages, to high end hotels. Meeting and greeting people all over the world has enticed us to start out own studio and airbnb on our property in the beautiful township of Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

name: Purpose-built Holiday Retreat
description: Our Barossa holiday retreat 'The Acre' is a mere 2 minute drive (or 15 minute walk) from the town centre of the Barossa's quintessential heartbeat, Tanunda. Set up for the traveller in all of us, with all the comforts one could need while on the road.
neighborhood_overview:
So close to the town centre yet far enough away for peace and quiet.

Just a 2 minute stroll down the road is Discovery Parks Barossa Valley. The family section of the park includes a splashtacular waterpark, complete with three slides, gigantic tipping bucket and more splash zones than we can count. (day passes available for $15, family and group pricing available on request).

And while the kids are playing in the water the folks can pop across the road to Barossa Valley Brewing. The brewery houses a Brasserie and stunning beer garden with live music from 4 - 7pm every Saturday and Sunday.

These are just two of the many cafés, galleries, museums and within walking distance, and dotted around the main street of Tanunda.

name: Walnut Cottage, Angaston
description: Walnut Cottage is a c1856 settlers cottage extensively renovated to retain the charm of a bygone era but with modern-day comforts. Exclusively yours, with generous provisions provided for continental breakfast. Relax by the open fire or enjoy a wine in the garden. The Cottage is located in a quiet street, a 5-min walk to cafes, wine bar, gourmet cheese shop & much more. With  just a 15-min drive to the wine region, Walnut Cottage is ideal for a romantic getaway or an escape with friends.
host_about: Love to travel: fav places are Okavango Delta, Morocco and Alaska. Also love to read, you will find lots of books in the BnB looking for a reader!

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury  Vineyard  Cottage  Hideaway
description: Situated in a  little town of Lyndoch in the Barossa Valley, your country cottage offers picturesque view of the Barossa Ranges surrounded by vines. Ideal for couples in need of a relaxing time to chill and relax in a country escape. The interior decoration consist of French antique with a touch of modernism. A perfect place to wake up to sunrise from your front veranda with a cup of espresso and enjoy the sunset from the gazebo with a glass of shiraz!
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by lovely vineyards and wineries, kangaroos and beautiful birds.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the calmness of the country yet just an hour away from Adelaide. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate. Tennis court is available to all guests of Bnb at no cost.
host_about: I am a Montessori teacher and at present working with children diagnosed with ASD. Love meeting people, friendly and easy going.

name: 10a on Elizabeth  - With Wifi and Smart TV
description:
Free Wifi Smart TV
Enjoy our home away from home. 3 minutes walk to restaurants, wine bars, coffee shops, pubs, clubhouse, boutique shops, supermarket and visitor centre on offer in the beautiful town of Tanunda.

3 bedroom all with ceiling fans, fully contained home perfect for families, friends or a romantic getaway. Fully equipped kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, full fridge, microwave and some breakfast provisions included.
neighborhood_overview: 3 minute walk from restaurants , wine bars and shops.
host_about:
Having myself lived in Tanunda almost 25 years and my husband always living in Tanunda we know The Barossa has a lot to offer and I take pride in knowing I provide 10a on Elizabeth as a clean and modern place to stay while visiting the many tourist attractions, wineries and restaurants. Comfortable beds and stylish touches to make sure you feel at home. I live only a few minutes away if you have any questions or assistance. 
Enjoy our beautiful part of the world. Jodie

name: JOHANN'S COTTAGE~ located in the heart of Tanunda
description:
"JOHANN'S" (pronounced Yo-hahns) is located in the world renowned Barossa Valley wine region. Steeped in history this heritage listed germanic cottage is over 160 years old & dates back to the 1860's.
Perfectly positioned in the main street of Tanunda only a short walk to restaurants, wine bars, cafes, beautiful retail shops and more.
Central to the entire Barossa food & wine district.
Perfect getaway for the romantic couple.
Private front and rear access with plenty of off street parking.

name: Meander Retreat Green Room - relax in the country
description: Meander Retreat is a small rural property near Eden Valley in the Barossa region, amid vineyards and open pastures.  The Green Room is full of comfort with a luxury bathroom, lounge, King bed and beautiful rural view. You can sit or hammock in the olive grove, wander the gardens or mixed orchard to write, paint or just daydream.  Meander will make you meander, change your plans, sleep long and sweet, and just untangle.
neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding.   There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub.  Nearest supermarkets are  20 mins away.

name: The Villas - Barossa. Peace. Beauty. Simplicity.
description: Located in the heart of iconic Seppeltsfield Road,  The Villas - Barossa provide the perfect home for exploring the nearby cellar doors, premium dining experiences and gin distillery and for walking or cycling in the stunning natural environment.    Comfy lounge, French linen sheets, soak tub - inside, The Villas provide a relaxed, intimate space. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the restful interiors of The Villas, offering a true bush retreat.
neighborhood_overview:
Marananga is a delight to explore, set amongst beautiful rolling hills and vineyards. The village is home to numerous cellar doors, five within an easy walk of The Villas. The award-winning Seppeltsfield Road Distillers are our near neighbours, and the renowned restaurant Appellation at The Louise is also within walking distance.

A drive along Seppeltsfield Road's iconic avenue of palms will wind you through the vineyards of the western Barossa with its well-known wine brands and intriguing small batch wine producers. Historic Seppeltsfield Estate is home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Vasse Virgin, Jam Factory Art & Design Studios and Fino restaurant. Just around the corner you'll discover Hentley Farm Cellar Door & Restaurant.

If you're looking for some adventure, try ballooning or a Segway, helicopter or trike tour. Or maybe a sunset cruise in a Mustang?

Beyond Seppeltsfield Road, the Barossa is a wonderful playground. More than 170 wineries, with

name: Strothers Farm House ~ Angaston, Barossa Valley
description:
Strothers Farm House *** Renovated 2018 *** SELF-CONTAINED ACCOMMODATION - *booking fee included *
The 100-year-old stone house is set on a hilltop on the outskirts of Angaston.
Is ideal if you’re looking to escape for a Romantic Getaway or share with a group of friends. This is the perfect house as a base while exploring the Barossa Valley or relaxing in the peace and quiet.
neighborhood_overview:
HISTORY
The property is set on 20 acres and was originally set-up as part of the Soldier Settlement Scheme in 1920 by Leslie George Strother (a returned WW1 Soldier). It has had a couple of owners throughout its time including Alan’s Grandparents, and Parents who both farmed the property. Today the property is mainly used for grazing Sheep.
host_about: I'm a non drinker that Worked in the Wine industry for over 20 years before retiring. Enjoy holidaying, camping.

description: A 2-Storyed, 3-bedroom country home, a 170-acre getaway that's exclusively yours, ideal for that special alone or to be enjoyed with friends. A total experience-not just another B&B.

host_about:
We are a family-operated/ father-daughter team!

name: The Loft
description:
The Loft is a beautiful 2 storey apartment with loft ceilings, renovated to host visitors in the Barossa Valley. The space is light and clean, furnished with modern neutrals and natural textures. All amenities are either organic, locally grown or made.
Located centrally in Tanunda, you are at walking distance to some of the best cafes, restaurants and local shopping in the Barossa.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is one of only 4 located on a lovely quiet street, with its own private entrance and parking. Located in the heart of the Barossa and walking distance to the main street of Tanunda, you are perfectly positioned for great access to all the great wineries, restaurants and experiences that the region has to offer.

name: The Clyde Greenock
description: Our sophisticated and charming self-contained accommodation caters for between 2 and 6 people, making it perfect for a romantic getaway or a memorable holiday for close friends. The best of the Barossa is right on your doorstep. Your tour can include world-class wineries, fine dining, intriguing heritage, gourmet produce, sweeping vineyard views and unique experiences.
neighborhood_overview:
The perfect location to explore the Western Ridge of The Barossa. In Greenock you have
-Wine & Craft Beer Tastings at * Murray Street Vineyards * Kalleske Wines * Dell'uva Wines * Ballycroft * Schluter Wines * Greenock Brewery
-Dining at * El Estanco & * The Greenock
-The perfect village to undertake the Greenock Historical Village Walk
-Hire a bike and explore the greater region
-Visit the world-renowned Seppeltsfield Winery (only a 5 minute drive from The Clyde)
host_about: Janine currently runs her own beautiful 5 star reviewed bed and breakfast in the quaint village of Greenock along with managing the stunning Benbullen Retreat in the heart of The Barossa. Janine has passionately developed her work within tourism to a full-time capacity, gaining a reputable name as a high quality accommodation provider in the Barossa Valley. Janine will be your host during your stay at Benbullen Retreat and The Clyde, ensuring you have the most ultimate accommodation experience the Barossa has to offer.

name: 'In The Vines' Guest Cottage, Barossa Valley SA
description:
‘In The Vines’ Guest Cottage, nestled among long-views of vineyards, villages & church spires. Fully appointed, our private accommodation is ideally placed to explore all that is The Barossa.

Minutes from the Barossa Farmers Market, cellar doors, galleries, cafes & award winning restaurants. Perfect for that romantic getaway, or quiet enough to focus on your business plans.
neighborhood_overview:
The famous weekly Barossa Farmers Market is just a kilometre away, open every Saturday morning - amazing produce, you'll also make friends in the short queue for a superb coffee.

Just across from the market is the award winning Vintners Restaurant, and we are situated not far from the four main villages of Angaston, Nuriootpa, Tanunda and Greenock. From ice creams, handcrafts, boutiques and pubs, we can recommend something to suit your preferences.

Likewise, cellar-door tours, balloon flights and more can easily be arranged, all picking up from your cottage.

Or just lay in one of our hammocks with a great bottle of wine and a book, we can supply most of your needs until sundown. We want you to become another returning guest, looking forward to your next stay with us - Your home from home, 'In The Vines'.
host_about: Andrew and I are an easygoing couple, enjoying our life out in the country where we grow grapes, tend our fruit trees, and enjoy mixing within the local community spirit that is country Australia. Let us introduce you to some new friends too!

name: Ten on French
description:
At Ten on French you can enjoy modern style living with all amenities. Features include separate lounge, fully equipped self catering kitchen and dining room, Smart TV, air-con, gas ‘log fire’ heating. There are 3 bedrooms, two with queen beds and one single bed with quality linen and quilts. The bathroom has lush towels and modern vanity with shower and bath. There is undercover parking, and a barbecue/outdoor entertaining area.
There is so much to enjoy within walking distance.
neighborhood_overview: An easy 4minute walk through the tree lined street to the historic township of Angaston. Stroll the main street, you’ll find some of the best food in the Barossa as well bakeries, cheese shop, hotels, restaurants, wine bars, and more. On Saturday mornings the local harvesters market sells fresh produce, you can enjoy your local produce breakfast sitting on the hay bales.

name: Mataro Cottage Tanunda - Stunning Accomodation
description:
Mataro cottage is a renovated 1925 cottage offering 2 bedrooms, separate lounge room with leather lounges, stunning full bathroom with second toilet located off the fully equipped laundry. Beautiful open kitchen with high quality appliances. Separate dining area overlooking the garden.
Fireplace combustion heater in lounge room, combustion heater in kitchen and oil coil heaters in all rooms. Evaporative air-conditioning cooler to all rooms.
Outdoors offers a patio area with seating.
neighborhood_overview: New Barossa chocolate factory with cellar door within 3KM, mmmmm!
