name: JHA Stone Cellar
description:
The JHA Stone Cellar is a blend of old and new with thick stone walls and large glass windows for wonderful farm views.

2 king bedrooms, both with en-suite bathroom, (1 bedroom splits to two king singles if required), large living area, butlers pantry, mud room and 3rd toilet.
An out door shower, under floor heating, air-conditioning and quality fittings through out giving our guests an exceptionally relaxed experience.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston township is 10 minutes away by car with specialty shops as well as all the services that might be required. The wider Barossa has more than 150 winery/cellar doors, 7 award winning restaurants, cafes, bakeries, art galleries, heritage sites, scenic bike tracks, parks and 2 golf courses.
host_about: I am part of a mixed family farm in the Barossa, with a strong interest in food and wine.

name: Tomfoolery Winemaker's Cottage - Barossa Valley
description:
Situated at the home of Tomfoolery Wines in the Barossa Valley, this newly renovated cottage is only about an hours drive north of Adelaide.
Located on the 20 acre winery property it is complete with all of the luxuries to enjoy your time away, including a king sized bed, a large spa, robes, Sheridan towels, wine and a full lounge area to relax in.
neighborhood_overview:
The Farmers' Market which opens every Saturday morning is just up the road so you can explore all the local produce the Barossa has to offer and top up on fresh supplies.

The three major towns of the Barossa Valley are all located within 10 minutes of the cottage and there are many other wineries and a variety of restaurants close by making it a fabulous location for a wine region getaway.
host_about:
Hi - I am Sarah. A Mum of 2 who is passionate about making sure our guests have the best stay every time.
We also own and operate a boutique winery in the beautiful Barossa. And we love what we do!

BAROSSA ACCOMMODATION IN WILLIAMSTOWN.
The Williamstown B & B is the perfect Barossa getaway for up to 6 guests. Located in the cosy town of Williamstown our beautifully renovated house is full of history and is conveniently located close to shops, bakery, restaurants, wineries and tourist attractions.

description: Located on the hillside with valley views and seven acres of land,  Lindsay House offers luxury accommodation in a farm yard environment with local eateries, cellars doors, walking and riding trails within a short walk.  Lindsay House Homestead offers 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities spread over two levels. Relax and take in the spectacular views on offer.

name: Barossa Valley Gundaroo - we offer 1 night stays
description: Gundaroo retreat is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and set on 50 acres of picturesque land with rolling farmland, trees and hills.  Perfect for a romantic getaway or a girls weekend away.  The cottage is set in a scenic location and provides a pleasing blend of rustic charm with modern conveniences.  It has 2 bedrooms with queen size beds, a cosy wood fire and a lovely deck to relax and enjoy your morning coffee.  We provide breakfast provisions for the first day of milk and cereal.
neighborhood_overview: There are so many places to visit that are quite close to us.  Birdwood with the motor museum is 5 minutes drive away, Gumeracha with the big rocking horse and wildlife park is 10 minutes.  If you like fishing or kayaking, the Williamstown reservoir is less than 10 minutes down the road.  There is also the Lavender farm at Williamstown and the wineries at Lyndoch are about 20 minutes away.  If you enjoy walking, Mt Crawford forest is also less than 10 minutes away.  There are some beautiful cafes  and local pubs in all of the towns that are close by.  Tanunda wineries are approx 30 minutes away and also the Barossa valley Chocolate Company.  Mount Pleasant is approx 5 minutes away, so if you are going to a horse show we are close by if you want to stay.  Monarto zoo is also approx 40 minutes away.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

name: Ironstone on Jollytown
description: A characterful ironstone cottage located in the heart of the Barossa. Equipped with all the modern amenities for the most discerning guest. The interior is a mix of contemporary and old to give the cottage a light, bright and airy feel while remaining true to it’s longstanding heritage. Situated on a large block, the garden wraps around the cottage to provide many places in which to relax and unwind.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is quiet and full of friendly people who always seem to be willing to stop for a chat. The lyndoch hotel is a short 15 minute walk down the road. If you prefer a glass of wine over a beer however, the lovely Reis Creek cellar door is situated just opposite. Lyndoch is a fantastic location as it is central in relation to many wineries and cellar doors. Barossa Chateau, Kies Family Wines, Kellermeister and Chateau Yaldara are all within 5 minutes driving distance of the accomodation. If you are looking to partake in a spot of golf, Sandy Creek Golf Club is a short 5 minute drive, while the Tanunda Pines Golf Club is located only 10 minutes away from the accomodation.
host_about: Brooke & Peter are Barossa Valley locals. Peter was born in Queensland and moved to South Australia to pursue a career in winemaking. Brooke is a born and bred Barossan who recently traded in her career in the wine industry to become a full time Airbnb host.

name: The Kirche - Luxury Vineyard Accommodation
description:
Situated on beautiful Krondorf Road, only three minutes from Tanunda, The Kirche offers a tranquil setting for either a long term or short term stay in the famous Barossa Valley.

This unique, historical building has been tastefully turned it into superb luxury vineyard accommodation without compromising the wonderful warmth and space evident in its origins.

Kirche is German for church. “The Zum Kripplein Christi” Lutheran Church was the centre of village life from 1864 through to the 1950’s.

name: Tal Haus - In the heart of the Barossa Valley
description:
In the heart of the Barossa! This well appointed home is perfectly located in the centre of Tanunda. Tal Haus is on the main street, and a just a 3 minute stroll to some of the region's finest restaurants and wine bars.

It is an older style home - built in 1928, it is a little piece of Barossa history and a great location to explore all that the region has to offer. Tal Haus offers all the comforts of home - suitable for couples wanting a relaxed getaway or a family who needs some space.
neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda is in the heart of the Barossa so you can head in all directions and find lots of things to see and do - including some of the world's best food and wine. Some of our favourites that are five minutes walk away include....

Ferment Asian - one of Australia's finest modern Asian. Not only is the food great, the award winning wine list is something to behold - http://www.fermentasian.com.au

Vino Lokal - Wine Bar, Restaurant and Tasting room you can sample some of the region's finest from wine producers. It is the home of Artisans of the Barossa which includes John Duvall, Hobbs of the Barossa, Spinifex, Sons of Eden and Schwarz Wine Co. And the food offerings from the Chef, Ryan Edwards are absolutely sensational. http://www.fermentasian.com.au

Musque - is the epitome of a modern eatery and bar, they have over 500 gins to sample but you can get a decent bottle of local wine, grab a burger or enjoy a more sophisticated dining experience. https:
host_about: I am anArts and Cultural Consultant with my own company Play Your Part.  Married, 2 kids living in the beautiful Barossa Valley.  We are not locals but have lived in the region since 2009 and have gotten to know the place really well.  I am a pretty social person - I love a long lunch, visiting galleries and museums or a day out with friends at the pub but could quite happily spend a day at home in front of the fire.

name: Ruby’s Residence: LOCATION - cozy - WIFI - netflix
description:
LOCATION IS WHAT WE OFFER

A sister to Lavender Cottage Barossa.

A cozy place in central Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100m from the main street (under five minutes walk to the shops, restaurants, wine bars, galleries, the Barossa Tourist Centre, also from Foodland, pharmacy, Recreational Park, Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum).

Linen, towels, soap, shampoo, conditioner are provided.
neighborhood_overview:
Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.

The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.

We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
host_about:

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

name: Uzuri Barossa
description:
Uzuri Barossa is a fully self contained guest house with a blend of classic and modern design set on our lush two-acre property a mere 3 minute drive from the quaint little town of Lyndoch, the gateway to the Barossa Valley. It is separate from our main house so you will have full privacy to enjoy our cosy guesthouse.

The name Uzuri means 'beauty' in Swahili, a homage to Kenya where my husband Kipi is from.
neighborhood_overview:
We are just a 13 minute drive to Tanunda the cosmopolitan heart of the Barossa with the best restaurants, entertainment and cellar doors. Award winning winery Kellermeister is just a two minute drive from us. The winery is rated in the top 7% of Australian producers by Australia's acclaimed wine critic, James Halliday.

For those who are a bit more adventurous, the Altona CSR Landcare Reserve which is highly rated on Tripadvisor Australia is located just opposite our property. It has a 6km walking track and is a great place to observe the wildlife and vegetation. Or you could wander down on to the Barossa Trail which is a shared cycling and walking path that goes from the outskirts of Gawler through Lyndoch, Rowland Flat, Tanunda, Nuriootpa to Angaston.
host_about:
I made the tree change with my husband Kipi and our two children in 2017 having lived half my life in Melbourne's hip and busy inner suburbs and the prior half in Malaysia. Now I enjoy a slower paced life surrounded by beautiful nature and amazing people.  

I love cooking and entertaining friends and family around my table. Our little family also enjoys travelling, particularly back to Malaysia and Kenya to visit our big families.

We renovated and converted the run down pottery studio on our property to a charming little guesthouse for our friends and family to stay when they visit us. We are happy to share our slice of paradise with travellers and holidaymakers. Meeting new people is always a pleasure and I look forward to hosting you and making your stay a comfortable and memorable one.

name: Devitt on French, quiet and romantic
description: Built in 1860, Devitt on French B&B is a step back to the old charms of yesteryear with the modern amenities that make for the perfect escape to the Barossa Valley. Complete privacy with a magnificent look out from the front verandah for your morning coffee.  Ideally set amongst the oldest houses in Angaston shaded by a Silver Ash and an old apple tree, this quiet street is an easy walking distance to the main street coffee shops, wine tasting rooms,  popular restaurants, and more.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is known as the Jewel of the Barossa and has many great coffee shops, wine tasting rooms , cellar doors  and restaurants from pizza, Italian cuisine, modern Australian to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company are all a short walk away. Or hire a bike from Angaston Hardware shop to ride the bike tracks of the Barossa or book a Barossa wine tour that can show you the sights and memorable places of the region.
host_about: I am married with 2 children and live on a farm where we bread Angus Beef cattle,  Dorper sheep, and manage remote agricultural maintenance and development business. I am an artists and involved in arts and cultural engagement in the Barossa.

name: Lavender Cottage BAROSSA - LOCATION!
description:
A cozy place centrally located in Tanunda, the heart of Barossa Valley, in a quiet street but only 100 metres from the main street:

- under five minutes walk to the iconic Fermentasian and 1918 restaurants, the popular Z wine bar, Musque restaurant and Vino Lokal as well as the Barossa Tourist Centre,

- easy walking distance to Foodland and Priceline pharmacy,

- 50 metres away from Tanunda Recreational Park,

- 20 minutes walk to Chateau Tanunda and Barossa Museum.
neighborhood_overview:
Elizabeth Street is one of the main streets in Tanunda with beautiful quiet neighbourhood.

The Oval/Recreational Park is just 3min walk away.

We are also a short walking distance to the major attractions of Tanunda (restaurants, cafes, shops, museum, wineries, tourism centre, oval, parks, etc).
host_about:
We live in Tanunda which my husband has called home for 30+ years and we both enjoy music, food, wine, travel, and much more. 

With these passions, we will try our best to make your stay enjoyable in this lovely wine region. 

Cheers,
Lizha* & Geoff

*Lee-sa

name: Vineyard Views
description:
Vineyard Views, hidden in the ridges of Menglers Hill near Angaston, on a working-vineyard, delivers everything you need for your next weekend getaway in the Barossa.
With Angaston a five-minute drive in one direction and world class wineries a five-minute drive in another, Vineyard Views has you covered. name: THE VINES Mount Pleasant.
description: In the township of Mount Pleasant a 5 minute walk to the Saturday morning Farmers Market where you can have coffee and an amazing breakfast, or 10 minutes walk to the hotel. You have the whole living space and porch to yourself. Drive in to your reserved parking spot. You then go through to your private area where a lock box code will gain you entry. Inside you will find everything you should need for a comfortable stay.Let me know if you require further details.
neighborhood_overview: Mount Pleasant is a lovely country town that feels rural however is close to so many wonderful tourist destinations.The famous Mount Pleasant  Farmers Market on every Saturday morning 8am-12pm. Pick up wonderful fresh fruits and vegetables all locally grown.There are cakes, pastries and amazing coffee. The breakfasts are also wonderful with something for everyone. We have one hotel, The Robbers Dog a great little gin distillery , two bakeries, a lovely quaint book and gift shop in Mount Pleasant all within walking distance. Considered the gateway to the Barossa there are local wineries just ten minutes drive or a 30 minute drive and you will be in the heart of the Barossa, Tanunda and Angaston with countless attractions. Twenty five minutes in another direction and you can be sitting on the banks of the river Murray in the lovely township of Mannum home to the  paddle steamer The Murray Princess.We are also close to the Adelaide hills with many other wineries to enjoy.

name: 'Mattschoss House c1890' - Barossa comfort & style
description: 'Mattschoss House' offers a unique place in Barossa Valley's history established in '1890'. Refurbished to reflect it's heritage with clean modern furnishings, a comfortable retreat all year round. Set along the Para River with vineyard views, an array of native birds and the infamous Western Ridge sunsets. Centrally located with great access to some of Barossa's iconic wineries and restaurants, with neighboring wineries just a stones throw from your front door.
neighborhood_overview:
Located on the iconic Seppeltsfield Road you are walking distance to neighboring wineries and a short drive to icons like Maggie Beer Farm Shop, Appellation Restaurant, Peter Lehmann Wines, David Franz Wines, and Seppelsfield Winery. The bustling main street of Tanunda is close hosting our Barossa's Tourism hub along with coffee shops, bakeries and retail shops.
On Saturdays you can head to our local Farmer's Market for breakie and meet, taste and explore our finest in produce, baked goods, gin, wine and so much more.
You wont be short of things to do in the Barossa, head to Barossa.com for all the latest. When considering your travel plan at least a few days, there is so much you wont have time to see it all!

name: It's Bonza at Mill About Vineyard, Barossa Valley
description: Relax in a private, inclusive & accessible cabin on a hobby farm in beautiful Barossa Valley. Inspired by the region's rustic charm, it features reclaimed corrugated iron walls & roof. Cosy yet spacious & comfortable: king-size bed (or 2 single beds), kitchenette, aircon+ceiling fan. Breakfast provisions. Wheelchair ramp, wide doors. Vineyard, nature, garden views. People of all abilities & walks of life, welcome! Suitable for a couple or 2 friends. No pets. A bottle of wine if 4+ nights booked.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Southern Barossa - offering the best of both the Adelaide Hills and the world-famous Barossa Valley. So much to explore: the wineries, restaurants and cafés, bushwalking and birdwatching in nearby nature reserves, kayaking and fishing at the local water reservoirs, historic sites and cultural events, a swimming pool in Williamstown, farmers markets and so much more ... A pleasant walking trail is just at our northern border - a 20min walk to Williamstown's cafes and shops, in the shade of old gum trees, and you could meet the neighbour's 2 curious alpacas that keep the grass down along the walking path :-)  We have prepared a guidebook and will be happy to suggest some local attractions.
host_about: We are lifelong learners, loving and observing nature and gardens. We like to travel light and visit places with no crowds. We live in the Barossa Valley, South Australia, and have retired from our careers in web management (Nelly) and satellite communications (Stan). Nelly looks after the guest cabin and the gardens, Stan tends our vineyard and makes wine.

This romantic place to stay offers a history all its own.

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery-Entire Main House!
description: Historic Lyndoch, is less than 1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD. Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable private house with all amenities, in this unique 1850’s colonial building. Price is for 2 guests (no extra cleaning fee). Additional guests (including children) are $25/person/night. Enjoy & entertain at your own Bar in the original Front Bar of the Inn (BYO drinks). Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston are nearby.
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the 'Gateway' to the Barossa Valley/ The residence gives you local ambience and history whilst providing a touch of luxury (enjoy the wonderful king-sized four poster-bed!). You have the opportunity to explore this vibrant foor and wine region, with the main Barossa towns - Tanunda, Nuriootpa and Angaston, all an easy drive away. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the BnB. The bicycle track from Angaston to Gawler and beyond, passes nearby. Our BnB is a great starting point for your cycling adventure.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

name: Barossa Loft Stay & Wood Oven Pizza Restaurant
description: Barossa Loft Stay is located on Grand Cru Estate, a picturesque working farm and winery. Enjoy all the house and estate has to offer. Take a walk around the scenic gardens/grounds and enjoy weekend dining in our Wood Oven Pizza Restaurant. A fully equipped kitchen and large indoor and outdoor entertaining areas offer the perfect setting for fun and relaxation. The house has a huge selection of movies to watch. Just perfect for relaxing and unwinding in front of the fireplace.
neighborhood_overview: Located a few minutes drive from Springton, 8mins from Mt Pleasant and 15mins from Birdwood. It is recommended that you bring supplies (outside the basic that is supplied) for your ease of stay. Alternate a short drive to Birdwood will see you sorted at the local supermarket.

name: Halletts Valley Hideaway
description: Charmaine and Steve are the hosts at Halletts Valley Hideaway - a luxurious self-contained cottage tucked away amidst vineyards on the outskirts of Tanunda, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. The property was rebuilt from the ground up in 2017, blending original timber beams and local stone with contemporary design to offer guests a haven of peace and comfort. Enjoy panoramic views of rolling hills, spectacular Barossa sunsets, kangaroos amongst the vines and blue wrens on the lawn.
neighborhood_overview:
Barossa Wineries…

The Barossa has a winemaking tradition stretching back to 1842 and, having escaped the ravages of the phylloxera virus that decimated many European and Australian vineyards in the nineteenth century, is home to some of the world’s oldest vines still in production. Today, the region is home to more than 150 wineries and 80-plus cellar doors. Whilst producers range from large-scale global operations to small-batch artisans they all retain a distinctly local character and visitors can be assured a warm welcome. The local tourist board provides a comprehensive guide to the region’s wine here. Here’s a few of our favourites (in no particular order):

Artisans of Barossa: a group of eight family-owned winemakers who share a tasting room on Murray Street, Tanunda – Hobbs of Barossa Ranges, John Duval Wines, Sons of Eden, Schwarz Wine Co, Purple Hands Wines, Spinifex, Lienert Vineyards and Chaffey Bros Wine Co.

Izway: a ten-minute drive from

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Retreat - Barossa getaway
description:
Set in the vineyards and gardens of Seize the Day wine estate, our three bedroom house offers relaxed, premium accommodation for up to 6 adults in modern country style
Explore, relax, unwind, share good food, wine & company. Walking distance to Hentley Farm, a stone’s throw from Seppeltsfield Winery & many local boutique cellar doors, restaurants, Gin Distillery & other attractions along iconic Seppeltsfield Road, the perfect base for you to enjoy your Barossa experience. *children over 12 only
neighborhood_overview:
Located just off the iconic Seppeltsfield Road.. We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also house the acclaimed FINO restaurant, and the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker, jewellery makers and potters. You will also find Octeine Coffee Cafe, and Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm ( which is right next door to us), Izway Wines, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske
host_about: Introducing people to all of the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what we love to do.  We love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowledge and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region.

name: Chinner Cottage on Park
description:
Chinner Cottage is located in one on the cutest towns in the Barossa, Angaston. Just a short walk (500m) to the Main Street.
The cute cottage is quaint while fully equipped with all you need for a wine and food getaway.
Breakfast provisions are supplied on the first day, however you’ll likely want to explore the nearby cafes such as Otherness, Hive and Casa Carboni. The front yard overlooks the town’s oval and tennis courts.
Please note this cottage does NOT accept infants, children and pets.
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston is one of the cutest towns in the Barossa.

There are plenty of wineries to discover - Home to Yalumba and close by are Flaxman, Poonawatta, Hutton Vale and Henschke.

Also home to Barossa Valley Cheese Company, Casa Carboni Cooking School, Otherness Wines and Vintners, a must for lunch or dinner.

On weekends the Doddridge Blacksmith Shop & Museum is open.

name: Peaceful 2br cottage in the 🖤 of Angaston
description: Plum Cottage is a 1940’s miner’s cottage, renovated to ensure all modern conveniences. Everything you need for a getaway to the Barossa.
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is on a quiet local street, 5 minutes walk from the main street of Angaston and its shops, supermarket, cafes, bakeries, pubs, restaurants, Casa Carboni cooking school and the Barossa Valley Cheese Company.

Angaston is surrounded by vineyards, fields and gums. Excellent access to Barossa wineries, the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle track, the undulating hills of Barossa’s high country, our fabulous Barossa Farmer’s market, and the multi award winning Vintners Bar & Grill.
host_about: Hi! I'm a 30-something who's recently moved back home to South Australia after time in Sydney and London. I enjoy rock climbing, swimming, reading, cycling, skiing, coffee, tea, food and wine.

name: LYNDOCH GRAND VILLA IN BAROSSA VILLAGE SLEEPS 14
description: Lyndoch Grand is located at the gateway to the Barossa Valley and this c1855 heritage-listed property is perfectly suited for large groups. It is fully self-contained with 7 bedrooms, 5 living rooms and 3.5 bathrooms. You'll have exclusive use of the entire house, conveniently located in the heart of Lyndoch village and a short walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries. With space, elegance and natural surrounds, it's the perfect base from which to explore the Barossa region
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is one of South Australia's oldest towns and is the gateway to the world famous Barossa Valley, just 56km north of Adelaide. It was the first Barossa town settled and the first vines were planted here. It still retains a quiet village feel, with the local hotel, supermarket, traditional butcher, bakery, library and post office a two minute walk away. Surrounded by vineyards and glorious red gums, Lyndoch is an ideal base for exploring all the Barossa has to offer.
host_about: I'm a self-employed musician and antique dealer. I'm outgoing, energetic and optimistic, with a keen sense of humour. I love my family, socialising with friends, hunting for interesting antique and vintage items and playing music. I enjoy cooking, especially Italian and Mexican food, and don't mind a nice cold beer.

name: Teresa Garden Holiday Home
description:
Teresa garden is a beautiful and historical cottage in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It only takes 2 minutes by car to reach Tanunda town.
You'll feel life has slowed down in this comfortable, peaceful, well equipped, quiet, sunny retreat.
Whilst reconnecting with nature, you can also discover Australia's most famous wine-producing region making this an ideal place to stay.
The cottage can accommodate at least 6 people, making it the perfect place for families or groups of friends.
neighborhood_overview: Teresa Garden is adjacent to Tanunda township. It is only a two minute drive from the town centre, shops and restaurants.

Both bathrooms have showers, underfloor heating and toilets, one has a bath tub

name: HISTORIC BAROSSA - 1890s 2 STOREY HAYLOFT
description:
Be part of Barossa History, and stay in the renovated Hayloft built by the original Herbig family, who used to live in the nearby famous Herbig Family Tree.

The hayloft is a romantic getaway for a couple , with a sofa bed located downstairs (& another upstairs) in the common area if required. (Max 3 people).

Upstairs in the Parisienne bedroom (ceiling fan & split system aircon), there is a beautiful view over the courtyard and ponds.

(Chromecast/wifi for streaming)

Welcome basket provided.
neighborhood_overview:
Checkout where Springton is on a map before booking!

The historic hamlet of Springton, population 600, is located in an amazing location to explore the local area:

The cottages are directly opposite the Edenmae cellar door, for tasting platters and food on Friday, Saturday and Sunday

All the Barossa wineries are within 30 minutes, with the closest being Henschke, Suffield, Eden Hall, Fernfield, Eden Valley, Rileys, Mountadam, etc

A must visit (just 5 mins away) is the Mt Pleasant Farmers Market (every Saturday 8am-12noon) - (Have a wonderful cooked breakfast there) , or you can choose the Barossa Farmers Market in Angaston every Saturday 730 - 1130am.

20 minutes from Historic Angaston, as well as Nuriootpa, Tanunda (go via the Menglers Hill lookout) and Lyndoch.

Take a 1km hike to the beautiful view of the forests and valleys from Mount Pleasant Summit (5 minute drive to trailhead on Glen Devon Rd)

Springt
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.

name: Flaxman: historic Goat Square Cottages in Tanunda
description:
Flaxman Cottage is one of three self-contained, connected heritage cottages in historic Goat Square in Tanunda. It features two bedrooms (with king and queen sized beds), spa bath, under-floor heating & a wood fire, and is the perfect place to retreat, relax and enjoy the Barossa Valley. Provisions are left to prepare your own country style breakfasts.

Experience intimate surroundings with thick stone walls, historic low ceilings, quality furnishings & extensive cottage gardens.
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is located in the historic heart of Tanunda. In times past, the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday at Goat Square. The cottages are within easy walking distance to the Main Street of Tanunda where the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill are located, as well as donuts and coffee at Browns Barossa Donuts.

name: Lambert's Little Paradise
description: Come and enjoy this spacious self-contained home away from home in the heart of the ever-spectacular Barossa Valley, South Australia.

name: The Station - luxury group accommodation
description:
The Station at Kapunda offers luxury group accommodation for 10 to 14 guests in a unique environment and within a short drive to both the Barossa and Clare Valleys.
Book with confidence. A full refund will be given for any cancellations due to government restrictions.
neighborhood_overview:
We think that you'll be surprised at just how much Kapunda has to offer. In addition to being only a short drive to the world renowned wine regions of the Barossa and Clare Valleys, the local area is worth exploring.

Book a tour of ANLABY STATION - a historic sheep station that has been lovingly restored including 20 acres of manicured gardens.
Explore the RETAIL outlets in the main street: homewares at KOCO HOME, plants and pots from PLANT POT & MORE, gifts and more at TINY NEST

ART & CULTURE plays a big role in Kapunda. Wander the streets to look at the award winning street murals and visit the regional gallery to pick up a piece or two.
If you are more serious about your creativity, enrol in a workshop to paint BLOOMS with Jacqueline Coates. You will need to book ahead - and hope that she is in town at the time and not in residence in Paris!

Of course - it's not far to other creative and culinary experiences:
Learn the in's and ou
host_about:
I have been lucky to have lived in some amazing places - from on a boat in Queensland, to a warehouse apartment in Collingwood, and now in the Barossa Valley where I own a 160 year old railway station.
As a traveller I love to immerse myself in the local culture of the places that I visit... but I know the importance of having a home to return to after a day of exploring (and maybe the odd wine tasting!).   The Station is a truly amazing but liveable space for groups of families and friends.   I am proud to share it with like-minded guests and I know that you will enjoy your stay in the Barossa.

name: Kalimna House
description:
This comfortable house is fully furnished and self contained and is suitable for families and friends to share. Accommodating up to 10 people. We welcome you to enjoy this lovely, quiet, natural setting, with country fresh air, close to amenities -10 min walk to shops, oval, swimming pool and bush gardens walking trail.
Check out our great walking and bike tracks - 30 min bike ride to Tanunda, Angaston.
Places of interest - Maggie Beers Farm, Manglers Hill and many winery's to mention.
neighborhood_overview: We have wonderful neighbors and is very quite.

name: Barossa Valley Views Eco Farm Stay Angaston
description:
Modern off-grid home on 10 acres, right in town. Some of the most spectacular valley views and sunsets the Barossa has to offer, all within 1km of the Angaston main street: Restaurants, cafes, supermarket and shops. Large deck, outdoor fire pit and BBQ. Beautifully decorated, large rooms with views of the Barossa Valley, landscaped gardens and horse paddocks. An eco farm stay, right in the middle of Angaston.
There is also an extra queen sized bedroom available if you have travelling companions.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a picturesque village in the Barossa Valley. Here you will find restaurants, several cafes, the Barossa Valley Cheese Co, Casa Carboni Italian Cooking School. The new adventure station & nature play precinct is only 500m from the gate, as is the beginning of the Angaston-Nuriootpa Walking Trail.

name: HISTORIC BAROSSA - 1890 STABLES WITH WOODFIRE
description:
Be part of Barossa History, and stay in the renovated Hayloft and Stables built by the original Herbig family, who used to live in the nearby famous Herbig Family Tree.

If you want a peaceful, relaxing time, and a base to explore the Barossa, Adelaide Hills and River Murray, the Stables is for you. The original 1890 Stables have been renovated to reflect the bygone era, but have all the modern conveniences available - inc. Chromecast for your streaming services!

Welcome basket provided.
neighborhood_overview:
Checkout where Springton is on a map before booking!

The historic hamlet of Springton, population 600, is located in an amazing location to explore the local area:

The cottages are directly opposite the Edenmae cellar door, for tasting platters and food on Friday, Saturday and Sunday

All the Barossa wineries are within 30 minutes, with the closest being Henschke, Suffield, Eden Hall, Fernfield, Eden Valley, Rileys, Mountadam, etc

A must visit (just 5 mins away) is the Mt Pleasant Farmers Market (every Saturday 8am-12noon) - (Have a wonderful cooked breakfast there) , or you can choose the Barossa Farmers Market in Angaston every Saturday 730 - 1130am.

20 minutes from Historic Angaston, as well as Nuriootpa, Tanunda (go via the Menglers Hill lookout) and Lyndoch.

Take a 1km hike to the beautiful view of the forests and valleys from Mount Pleasant Summit (5 minute drive to trailhead on Glen Devon Rd)

Springton G
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

name: Crush Guest Room & Ensuite-Hewitson Barossa Valley
description:
‘Crush’ Guest Room is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.

The suite opens to small courtyard garden and is a 15 metre walk to the deck overlooking our vineyard. Take in these unparalleled views while enjoying a glass of Hewitson and cheese platter.
neighborhood_overview:
If CRUSH room is not available with your schedule, we have another guest room that you could find on Airbnb (PRESS & FERMENT Room) that might be available for you.
There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

name: Rural retreat! 5 min to wineries / 10 min to town
description:
Turret Ridge is the perfect group entertainer. We have 85 acres of farmland to explore with breathtaking views over the whole valley, especially at sunset.

We’re only 10 minutes from Tanunda, (the best village in the Barossa!) and several of the most interesting cellar doors are right on our doorstep.
neighborhood_overview:
Rural retreat. The only neighbours are kangaroos and the kookaburras who you’ll hear in the mornings.

…but we are only 10 minutes from the wonderful township of Tanunda.
host_about: Love to travel for work and pleasure

name: Exclusive Barossa country lodge/retreat
description: Balmoral Lodge is a stunning, 1920s farmhouse with all the grandeur of a country estate, exclusively for you to enjoy.  Located 5 minutes from Lyndoch and 10 to Gawler, it enjoys the best of town and country.  Large, spacious rooms, a huge and bright chef's kitchen with all the facilities to self cater for a large group.    Bedrooms are individually decorated and 6 of the bedrooms are ensuite.  The spectacular veranda is the place to be, to enjoy sunset views over the lovely valley beyond.
neighborhood_overview: A lovely rural area with walks to enjoy and lots of wildlife.  Only 10 minutes to the town of Gawler and all the amenities.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cat Leonard and love all the wonderful wildlife on our doorstep. We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

Located centrally near the Angaston to Tanunda bike track and walking distance to the Provenance Barossa, offering gin, coffee, craft beers and wood oven gourmet pizzas.

name: Oldham House - Bagot Suite hosted B&B in Kapunda.
description:
Oldham House is a grand home with comfortable and private accommodation within a hosted B&B environment. With a grand garden full of flowers for guests to enjoy, a sumptuous spa bath and heavenly bed, it is a feast for the senses. It is a gracious and charming place to stay. Two suites are available to guests - the Dutton and Bagot Suites.
For more information please go to my website https://www.oldham.house/.
neighborhood_overview: Set ideally between the Barossa and Clare Valleys, Kapunda has a rich history and is conveniently located only an hour from Adelaide.

name: Basedow Haus Barossa Valley
description: Enjoy classic charm and contemporary luxury with exclusive use in a fully renovated historic home. Basedow Haus offers two king-sized bedrooms and many original period features. Outstanding light filled open living area with well equipped kitchen, large country style dining setting, a casual sitting area, a contemporary bathroom, separate toilet and al fresco dining patio. There is an abundance of space inside and out. Basedow Haus is the perfect place to experience the Barossa.
neighborhood_overview: Basedow Haus is situated in a residential historic zone away from the main street overlooking vineyards and the Chateau from the front and distant hills from the rear. The main street is a short 300 metres stroll with access to many cafes', restaurants and shops. The supermarket is a 200 metre walk and is open 7AM - 7PM.

name: Barossa house in the vines & stunning valley view!
description: The essence of Barossa living! Fantastic valley view over the vines. Nestled in the bush but only 5 minutes from Tanunda and Nuriootpa. Relax with the whole family at this modern family home with stunning outdoor entertaining area and hot tub overlooking the valley. All the amenities set on 5 acres; the perfect country retreat!
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of the Barossa, you will be staying on the famous Stonewell Road, surrounded by some of Barossa’s most iconic wineries such as Torbreck, Peter Lehman, David Franz, Rolf Binder, Greenock Creek and Seppeltsfield.

You are similarly close to many of the iconic restaurants with Appelation at the Louise walkable from the house but Fino at Seppeltsfield, Maggie Beers and FermentAsian only a short drive. For the spirit lovers amongst you, Seppeltsfield Road Distillery is just around the corner offering gin and cocktails in a stunning setting!

The property is located in the Marananga subregion of the Barossa producing the best of Barossa Shiraz.
host_about:
David and Anna love food, wine and nature travel. Australians but have travelled and lived abroad extensively, currently on an adventure with two young daughters based out of Muscat, Oman.

We hope our properties reflect our love of nature above all else and that appreciation and value will be shared by our guests. 

As hosts ourselves we treat any stay like we would our own house and will treat your home with utmost respect!

name: Peace and serenity in the heart of the Barossa
description: Archery Road Estate is a bouquet vineyard nestled in the heart of the famous picturesque Barossa Valley. The 1880s farmhouse offers an exclusive getaway for a couple, family or group of friends. The spacious retreat has four bedrooms, comprising of three queen size beds and one twin bedroom. Relax on the deck with a complimentary bottle of Jacob’s Creek wine and enjoy views of the cottage garden, vineyard and tall gums or work up a sweat on the property’s private tennis court.

name: Magpie House
description: Magpie House is a beautifully appointed home just metres from the main street of Tanunda, location does not get better than this! Take advantage of our free private parking and step out the front gate into the town centre.  Surrounded by some of the finest restaurants, bars, cafes and shopping experiences the Barossa Valley has to offer, you will enjoy exploring this charming region right on your door step.
neighborhood_overview: Magpie House is located in the centre of Tanunda. Within walking distance to the main street we're positioned just behind 1918 Bar & Grill and across the road from FermentAsian and the famous Apex Bakery. Next door to the property is the beautiful Tanunda Rotunda Park.
host_about:
Being a fifth generation Barossan I am excited to share this beautiful region with all it has to offer! I pride myself on providing a stylish, modern and clean home for guests to enjoy throughout their stay. I hope you love Magpie House and the township of Tanunda as much as I do. As I live in Tanunda I am just a phone call away should you have any questions or require assistance.
Sandy

name: Angaston Lodge  - 7 acres
description:
Quiet and peaceful on top of the hill, and in beautiful Angaston, this apartment has its own garage with direct access and is fully self-contained with washing machine, dryer, full kitchen and much more - perfect for longer stays or just the weekend.
If you are here to explore the Barossa and Eden valley areas, this is perfect. Just 15 minutes drive or less to Henscke, Penfolds and 80 more, or just explore historic Angaston and its wonderful bakeries, cheese shop or restaurants such as Vintners.
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is the most beautiful of the Barossa Valley villages and has excellent views, restaurants (including Otherness and Vintners), cafes, bakeries, cheese shop, cooking school and much more. Most wineries and the best restaurants are within 15 minutes drive. Angaston is also at the start of the Barossa bike/walking trail

name: Anlaby Station - Manor House One Bedroom
description:
The Manor House is a two story building .
There are three bedrooms upstairs (1 King, 1 Queen and 1 Split King), accessible via a set of stairs.
A very comfortable sitting room, fully set up kitchen (Incl. dishwasher, espresso machine) and one bathroom (shower) are downstairs. The Manor House has ducted A/C.
Car parking and free WiFi are available.
Breakfast provisions are supplied.
Dinner can be ordered by prior arrangement
The rate is set per room occupied (max 2 occupants per room).
neighborhood_overview: Anlaby Station is superbly located halfway between the world renowned Barossa Valley and Clare Valley wine regions.

name: Anlaby Station - Head Gardeners Cottage 1 Bedroom
description:
Gardeners Cottage
Located in the precinct of Anlaby homestead, this cottage was built for the Head Gardener in the early 1900s. At this time, the Head Gardener was responsible for the 14 gardeners who lovingly tended the historic Anlaby garden.

The cottage has three beautifully appointed Queen bedrooms, two comfortable lounges, a modern bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen. The building sits in its own beautiful cottage garden.

This is an ideal location for a quiet getaway while you take a ¿beautiful step back in time¿ surrounded by modern creature comforts.

The cottage is fitted with a fully ducted air conditioning system and free WIFI is provided.

Locally sourced breakfast provisions are supplied. Evening meals can be pre-booked.

Entire cottage
You will have the entire cottage to yourself

House Rules
Check in 2.00pm-7.00 pm
Check out 10.00 am
No smoking
No pets
No parties or events
neighborhood_overview:
The Head Gardener's Cottage is one of the numerous historical buildings at Anlaby Station.

It has been lovingly restored and now provides modern amenities such as air conditioning, a wood fire, TV and WiFi.

Car parking is available on site.

name: "Lochnagar Barossa"  - Central Barossa Location -
description: Situated on the picturesque Langmeil Estate on the edge of Tanunda, with its quiet streets and beautiful parklands, this large architect designed modern executive home with an impressive garden and 3 en-suite bedrooms is the perfect base for your visit to the wine capital with three excellent wineries within walking distance.
neighborhood_overview:
Lochnagar is an ideal location - there are 6 winery cellar doors within 2 kilometres!
• Langmeil Winery
• RieslingFreak
• Peter Lehman Wines
• Auswan Wines
• David Franz
• Rolf Binder Veritas
• Lindsay Wines

The central section of the main street (Murray Street) is 1.8 km from your accommodation. There you will find great restaurants and cafes, including:
• FermentAsian
• 1918
• Tanunda Clubhouse
• Musque
• VinoLocal
• Z Wine

name: Kiron - Cottage in Kapunda, gateway to the Barossa
description: A quirky stone cottage with WiFi and Netflix in a peaceful street of Kapunda. Kiron is pet friendly with a large secure backyard & doggie door. It's a 5-minute walk to the main street where you'll find a variety of cafes, pubs & eclectic shops. Kiron has 2 bedrooms & a third with a daybed that doubles as a single bed. There is undercover locked parking, a well-equipped kitchen and 3 living areas. There's also a separate loo & the bathroom hosts a rainfall shower over a deep bath.
neighborhood_overview: Robe street is a quiet neighbourhood street. You are just around the corner from the Memorial Gardens and Bowling Club. One block in the other direction is the peaceful duckpond with boardwalk and seating areas. And only a few minutes more walk and you are in the main street. There you will find a large Foodland open 7-7, 7 days/week, many coffee shops, home decorating and flower shops, galleries and even a Woodland Toys shop - where there are no battery operated toys and barely any plastics. And a 24hour service station!

This unique piece of Barossa History caters exclusively for up to six people.

name: 1 Small Batch Accommodation
description:
Accommodation with an environmental focus. Stay off grid, in a tiny historic hamlet. Situated between the Barossa Valley and the Adelaide Hills. This ongoing project utilises reused, recycled Nissan Huts (2 huts) to provide a cosy place to stay. 100% solar powered and filtered rain water. The rooms can be configured to suit a couple or twin share on request.
All bookings receive a bottle of local Springton/Eden Valley wine and a cheese plater box from the Barossa Cheese Company.

Situated in a beautiful tree line street in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Only a short walk from Barossa's finest restaurants and cafes. Birchwood on Bridge is a stylish & private villa. Built in 1890 this stunning marble fronted villa contains 3 spacious bedrooms, large fully equiped kitchen, cozy open fire places & 2 bathrooms. The garden is a peaceful retreat with a spa, vine covered patio & BBQ area.

All bedrooms contain king beds which can be split into singles if required.

name: The Cottage at Seppeltsfield
description: Welcome to our charming cottage in Seppeltsfield, Barossa Valley. This historic gem offers a peaceful  retreat for your stay. With its heritage exterior and modern amenities, the cottage accommodates up to 4 guests. Immerse yourself in Seppeltsfield’s rich heritage, within walking distance of nearby Wineries and Restaurants, or simply soak up the views across the vineyards. Experience the perfect blend of old-world charm and contemporary comfort in our Seppeltsfield cottage.
neighborhood_overview: Seppeltsfield  is a charming and historic destination nestled in the picturesque Barossa Valley in South Australia. With its quaint heritage buildings, rolling vineyards, and a sense of timeless beauty, Seppeltsfield offers a captivating experience for visitors. Within a short walk is the renowned Seppeltsfield Winery, which boasts a rich heritage spanning over 170 years. Visitors can explore the historic cellars, indulge in exquisite wine tastings, dine at Fino Restaurant, enjoy a coffee at Octeine or immerse themselves with the local artisans including The Jam Factory, Vasse Virgin, Gardner Knives and more. After a long day enjoy the west facing verandah watching the sun setting over the palm trees and vines. Sit back and enjoy the quiet, serene surroundings while looking up at the stars and the Milky Way. Seppeltsfield is a delightful destination that captures the essence of the Barossa Valley's wine country charm.

name: 2 Small Batch Accommodation
description:
Accommodation with an environmental focus. Stay off grid, in a tiny historic hamlet. Situated between the Barossa Valley and the Adelaide Hills. This ongoing project utilises reused, recycled Nissan Huts (2 huts) to provide a cosy place to stay. 100% solar powered and filtered rain water. The rooms can be configured to suit a couple or twin share on request.
All bookings receive a bottle of local Springton/Eden Valley wine and a cheese plater box from the Barossa Cheese Company.

name: Quiet Rural Retreat in beautiful wine country

name: The Red Door @ Barossa Valley ★Vineyard View★
description:
Take in the stunning views over the vineyard, The Red Door @ Barossa Valley provides a relaxed and intimate space facing an 10-acre working vineyard. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the modern natural light-filled house. As soon as you walk through the central red door, you will be met with quality fittings and features with multiple large windows to capture the outside views.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is closed to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This beautiful and comfortable house is perfect for small groups of friends and families as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

The Coachman's Cottage is a lovingly renovated single storey building sitting within its own garden with covered patio, seating and BBQ.
It offers 2 King bedrooms, each with its own ensuite.
You will find a wonderfully cosy sitting room and dining area as well as a fully set up kitchen (Incl. dishwasher, espresso machine).

name: Sierra Madre - Idyllic stay in the heart of town.
description:
Its all about the location.... Immerse yourself into the heart of the iconic Barossa Valley and stay at the Idyllic, Character filled bungalow - Sierra Madre.
A Beautiful, quaint and very charming property conveniently situated only meters from the ever so popular Tanunda main street. Take your pick of coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, cellar doors, shopping, and more.
Or... Choose to stay in, unwind, relax and surround yourself in a beautiful and well appointed little piece of paradise.
neighborhood_overview:
You wont find a much better location than this!
Sierra Madre is a short 2 minute walk to the hub of Tanunda.
You are walking distance to everything you need, Information Center, Supermarket, Bakery, Restaurant's, Bars, Cafes, Bottle shop, Retail Shopping, Playground / Oval and more.

The Barossa is made up of some beautiful little towns only a short drive away, and they all offer something different. So we encourage you to take a drive around and find some of our unique spots, You wont be disappointed.
There is always plenty to do and something for everyone.

Explore the many cellar doors and wineries, enjoy a relaxing long lunch at one of the many restaurants, take a stroll through the conservation park, visit the bustling farmers market, stroll the streets, or perhaps book yourself in for an unforgettable experience somewhere. So much to see and do.

name: Nell’s Place - Cottage in Barossa
description: Unwind in front of the cosy fireplace or sip a glass of wine with friends on the front porch at sunset. Located in one of the oldest tree lined streets of the village of Greenock, a short walk to picturesque cellar doors, a craft brewery and a classic country pub.
neighborhood_overview:
Escape to Greenock, South Australia: 'The best-kept secret in the Barossa Valley'. Less than an hour from Adelaide’s CBD, the charming village of Greenock is the gateway to the Barossa Valley wine region.

Take a stroll down to El Estanco cafe for breakfast and coffee, lunch, or dinner at their ‘Friday Fiestas’. Enjoy a good pub meal at the 'Greenock', or a platter at one of the cellar doors which are within walking distance of your cottage stay. One of many local hangouts, Greenock Brewers’ have a selection of small-batch beers. If you need a pre-dinner snack, grab yourself a produce platter and while away the afternoon.

Explore the lovely towns of Sepplestfield and Maranaga just a few minutes' drive away or a little further on - the towns of Tanunda, Nuriootpa and also Angaston - here you will find the Barossa Farmers Market with its abundant selection of fresh fruit and vegetables, herbs, meats, speciality bread, Barossa’s famous smallgoods, fresh milk, stunni

name: Deluxe Queen Room
description: Relax with the whole family at this peaceful place to stay.
host_about:
The Wine Vine Hotel offers affordable accommodations in the heart of the Barossa wine region, less than 1.2 km from the Barossa Wine and Visitor Center.

All rooms at the The Wine Vine Hotel include air conditioning, electric blankets, and a private outdoor veranda.

You can enjoy a game of tennis on the court, and in the summer season between October and April you can enjoy a swim in the pool.

The The Wine Vine Hotel gives you easy access to over 100 wineries. Famous local attractions are Mengler Hill Scenic Look-out, Conservation Park Bush, and the Whispering Wall.

The Barossa Cheese Company, Lyndoch Lavender Farm, Concordia Fruit Wines, and Maggie Beer's Farm Shop are all a short drive from the motel.

Couples in particular like the location – they rated it 8.5 for a two-person trip.

The Wine Vine Hotel has been welcoming (Website hidden by Airbnb) guests since Apr 19, 2010

The The Wine Vine Hotel gives you easy access to over 100 wineries. Famous local attractions are Mengler Hill Scenic Look-out, Conservation Park Bush, and the Whispering Wall.

The Barossa Cheese Company, Lyndoch Lavender Farm, Concordia Fruit Wines, and Maggie Beer's Farm Shop are all a short drive from the motel.

Couples in particular like the location – they rated it 8.5 for a two-person trip.

The Wine Vine Hotel has been welcoming (Website hidden by Airbnb) guests since Apr 19, 2010

name: Charming cottage in Angaston
description:
The Rusty Olive is an intimate lovers retreat nestled in the heart of Angaston, one of the most beautiful towns in the Barossa Valley wine region. The cottage is located in a quiet street, a 5-min walk to cafes, wine bar, popular restaurants, gourmet cheese shop, local bakery, butcher & much more. Only a 15-min drive to the wine region, it's ideal for a romantic getaway.

Come and relax under the rustic pergola area and prepare yourself a tasty gourmet breakfast with local produce supplied.
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston, South Australia, Australia . Angaston is the prettiest town in the Barossa with a rich history and beautiful gardens. it has a wonderful German butcher, bakery and gourmet cheese shop plus restaurants and cafes all within walking distance of The Rusty Olive.

At sunset, unwind with a glass of Barossa wine on the front verandah overlooking the old stone faced St Hugh's Anglician Church, opened in 1931.
host_about:
A short history of ownership... The Rusty Olive was built in 1900 and was bought in an unrestored state by Sue and Michael Falkenberg in 2008. Sue and Michael then spent some 8 years restoring it to the magnificent building you see today. The original stonework was preserved, and the interior completely rebuilt with a sympathetic mix of modern and existing features. 

The home was designed as a luxury retreat and has been operating as an Airbnb since 2018. In April 2022, Sue and Michael sold the property to the current owners, Adam and Marilyn Laws. They fell in love with the Rusty Olive after staying for two weeks early in 2022. Marilyn grew up in the Barossa Valley and most of her family still reside here. Now based in Sydney, they regularly return “home” to experience the great lifestyle and family experiences in the Barossa. 

We hope you enjoy your stay in The Rusty Olive.

Located at Rowland Flat, with beautiful vineyard at site, the Rocky House provides the ideal escape from everyday life. Enjoy billiard at pool room, or simply sit under the pergola breathe the very fresh Barossa Valley air.
2 bedrooms with Queen size bed and 2 bedrooms have 2 single beds in each room. An ideal location to base you and up to 8 friends in the Barossa Valley.

With dedicated staff based in the Barossa Valley, we know the Barossa Valley and can offer experiences that we have planned to perfection and enjoyed ourselves. name: Yaldara House - House next to a Chateau
description: The Yaldara House is a luxurious 5 bedroom accommodation venue situated at Chateau Yaldara on the banks of the Lyndoch Creek. Originally built by the founder of Chateau Yaldara, Hermann Thumm, it has been lovingly restored to now provide you with an ideal location to base your Barossa Valley Holiday or simply hide away in the Yaldara house and enjoy wine and an escape from everyday life.
neighborhood_overview: Chateau Yaldara. Hermann Thumm founded Chateau Yaldara in 1947 after he migrated to Australia from Europe. The chateau was named ‘Yaldara’ after the local Aboriginal word meaning ‘sparkling’. The site chosen for the winery was on the banks of the North Para River at a flax mill dating back to 1867.

name: Barossa on Sturt
neighborhood_overview:
The Barossa is an internationally-acclaimed wine region encompassing the towns of Tanunda, Angaston and Nuriootpa, boasting more than 150 wineries and 80 cellar doors.

Just a 50 minute drive north east of Adelaide, When you’re not sipping the region’s top drops you can admire the vines from a hot air balloon, dine at renowned restaurants and explore nearby villages and national parks.

name: Spacious first floor just for you! Gawler SA
description:
Enjoy easy access to the popular Barrosa Valley wineries, shops and restaurants from this charming place to stay in Gawler.

We are located next to a beautiful park full of native trees and home of all native birds that enjoy of the water of the Para River, short walk to town centre (15 min walk through park), train stations (3), 15 min drive to the heart of the famous Barrosa Valley and 40 min away from Adelaide CBD and airport!

You’ll stay in a private room in first floor.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a small complex of 4 units, quiet, clean and green area where you can find peace and a lot of rest without interruption or noise.
We have 1 train station close to home (Gawler station) and another two further north, the first one is within walking distance as well as 500mts away from Bus stop.
You can always park on the street (outside the complex) there is plenty of space!
host_about:
I'm passionate about travelling, meet new people and enjoy a good talk about travel, experiences and culture! 
I usually travel with my husband who shares the same values and friendless with people .. we simply love travelling and knowing new places :)

name: Horse Side Tiny House
description:
Experience the unhurried backcountry retreat at Horse Side Tiny House! The ideal farm stay South Australia escape nestled in wide-open spaces, native birdlife, and farm animals (e.g., such as horses, sheep, and alpacas) to keep you company. An amazing piece of paradise, where you can take deep calming breaths and lazy afternoon naps in Kapunda. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that the tiny house is only a short distance from the main street, so you may hear passing vehicles on the property.
neighborhood_overview:
Horse Side Tiny House sits in a small town near Barossa Valley in South Australia. Where you can explore restaurants, shops, and attractions for you to enjoy. So, make an endless list of things to do.

Our local recommendations:

- Pizza Bar and Takeaway serves a diverse selection of ingredients for dine-in and takeaway pizzas in town.
- One White Kite is a cafe that offers a delicious selection of pastries, light meals, coffee, and tea in Kapunda.
- Kapunda Mine Trail is a popular attraction that marks the first commercially copper metal mine in Australia.
- Kapunda Tourist Park is a camping and cabin accommodation set in a well-shaded park in Dutton Park, Kapunda.
- Whispering Wall is a popular attraction where "whispered words" can be heard 140 meters away from the other end of the dam.

If you want to know more, you can check out "Things to Do near Kapunda."
host_about: Tiny Away spearheads the tiny house eco-tourism in Australia. It started because of our desire to offer city dwellers the perfect place to escape from their hectic digital life in the city. Riding on the international trend in tiny houses, we have taken the tiny house movement one step further by partnering with land hosts and placing our beautifully designed and handcrafted tiny homes on wheels in spectacular rural settings. By integrating the concept of tiny houses with eco-tourism, we want to allow everyone a chance to experience the tiny house lifestyle - To Discover Nature and Stay in Comfort.

description:
The perfect place for a couples Barossa getaway.

Tanunda main is a gorgeous 1915 built sandstone fronted cottage barely a 5 minute walk to the towns vibrant tourist centre. It's a perfect location to relax, unwind, and meander down to great restaurants, pubs, cafe's and wine bars.

name: Ferment Suite - Hewitson Guest Suite
description:
'Ferment' Guest Suite is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.

The suite opens to small courtyard garden and is a 15 metre walk to the deck overlooking our vineyard. Take in these unparalleled views while enjoying a glass of Hewitson and cheese platter.
neighborhood_overview:
If FERMENT Suite is not available with your schedule, we have another guest room that you could find on Airbnb (CRUSH & PRESS Room) that might be available for you.
There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

name: Comfy Studio 3 @ Blickinstal Barossa Valley
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is closed to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is only a 5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: The Winemaker's Haus
description: Live like a local and enjoy this stylish and spacious property, surrounded by vineyards just 2 minutes from Tanunda's main street. Inside you will find a fully equipped kitchen, lounge and dining room with woodburning stove and sunset views. Outside you will find a landscaped garden with a BBQ and veranda, fire pit, and more spectacular vineyard view.  Beyond the house take a 15-minute stroll into Tanunda and enjoy the Barossa's central hub with several restaurants, bars, pubs and a brewery.
neighborhood_overview: We are located just outside Tanunda, with its wineries, cafes, boutiques and restaurants. From the house it's a 5 minute walk to Turkey Flat winery or Barossa Valley Brewing, or take a 15 minute stroll into Tanunda for a coffee or bite to eat. Alternatively take a 10 minute drive to world famous wineries including Jacobs Creek, Seppeltsfield and Penfolds. Or simply stay at home and enjoy sunset over the vines, and maybe even moonrise over the hills on the right night.
host_about: I'm a restauranteur, chef and winemaker in the Barossa Valley. I moved to the Barossa from the UK to pursue my passion for wine. The Winemaker's Haus was our first home and the place where it all started for me and my wife. I am co-owner of Harvest Kitchen and produce wines under my own label - Haus Wine. With over 20 years of hospitality experience and an enthusiasm for all things food and drink I decided it was time to host my own guest house and help people discover the Barossa and all its wonder!

name: Tanunda House - Luxury 5 BR in Barossa Wine Region
description: Prepare to be wowed as you enter this stunning home and discover your private luxury escape set on an acre of beautiful grounds in the heart of Tanunda. A 5 minute walk to excellent restaurants, cafes and wine bars, Tanunda House, with its 5 King bedrooms, pool, tennis court, wine cellar and theatre room is a perfect setting for a relaxing retreat or to celebrate a special occasion with friends, family or colleagues.  It is also an ideal base for exploring the world renowned Barossa wine region.
neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda House is located in the attractive town of Tanunda which is the heart of the world renowned Barossa wine region. A walk around the neighbourhood will lead you down leafy streets past beautiful sandstone homes, historic cottages and a number of lovely old churches - a testament to the Lutheran settlement of the region. Only 50 metres from Tanunda House is Goat Square - an historic meeting place which is now a lovely green lawn surrounded on all sides by heritage 1840s stone cottages.
Restaurants, cafes and wine bars and a wonderfully eclectic selection of shops and galleries for browsing are a short 5 minute walk away from Tanunda House but if you get in your car you can be out driving past vineyards, wineries and charming villages within minutes.

name: Rural garden studio with BBQ patio and dog park
description: This homey studio is extra comfortable, fully equipped and pet-friendly. There's an expansive garden and fenced area for a dog to run, and beautiful pastoral surroundings.  Also a connected patio with BBQ and wood oven.  Sleeps 3 adults
neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding. There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub. Nearest supermarkets are 20 mins away.

name: Rockridge, apartment pet friendly rural setting
description:
Pet friendly rural farm stay. Newly renovated & fitted out apartment. Views overlooking tall gums & dam , listen to the kookaburras singing, say hi to our beautiful friendly horses. Walking distance to township filled with some unique shops. Farmers market held each Saturday morning just a mere walk down the driveway.
An easy drive to the beautiful Barossa Valley wine region to taste all the Barossa has to offer.
Close to Mt Crawford forest for those who like to be do some bush walking
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to township where you can find some quirky shops, a fabulous gin distillery called Robbers Dog a must visit.
Rustic Edge home and western wear filled with amazing gifts and clothing and flowers.
As we are the gateway to Barossa Valley wine region it’s a short drive to experience all the valley has to offer.
Into a bit of bush walking ? Mt Crawford forest just down the road some lovely bush trails to explore.
Travel east and you will find the River Murray and Mannum Falls. Another short drive takes you into the heart of Adelaide Hills so much to see there the iconic town Hahndorf.
As you can see we are very central to so much.

Marananga Cottages are located in the heart of Marananga, an ideal venue from which to experience the delights of the Barossa Valley.


This enchanting cottage comprises three individual suites, all self-contained and ideal for couples. All suites have access to free Wi-Fi.
The cottage is perfectly located to access the many wineries and restaurants in the historic Seppeltsfield area, all just a short distance from your accommodation.

With only a short 10 minute stroll into the heart of Angaston, you can visit a range of coffee shops and eateries, or take a drive to some world-renowned wineries. After a day out exploring, wind down with a wine and a luxe charcuterie board at sunset in your own private courtyard space overlooking the Angaston hills.

name: The Reserve Barossa
description: The Reserve Barossa is Brilliant and Unique for so many reasons. Set amongst some of Australia’s best vineyards on the best street in the Barossa, Seppeltsfield Road. 6 acres and > 10 people in 5 bedrooms. It has an open plan full kitchen, 3 bathrooms, living and dining areas, laundry, small library/wine room and open fire. There are magnificent vineyard views, large outdoor area with a pizza oven. The Reserve Barossa is the perfect escape to relax & indulge all the Barossa has to offer.

name: Three bedroom Vineyard View Villa @ Blickinstal
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is close to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is onlya  5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: Para River Cottage
description:
‘Para River Cottage’

Built in 1920 overlooking the gum studded cliff face of the North Para River, this quaint and cosy cottage has been elegantly restored for your fulfilment.

Embrace the quiet rural feel of native birdsong and scattered sheep across the way, all whilst being within a short stroll of the heart of Tanunda.

It’s a great spot to discover the Barossa Valley and a lovely neighbourhood. I have so many great memories here, and I’m convinced that you will too.

name: Isadore House
description: Embark on a journey at Isadore House, as you immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of the world-renowned Barossa Valley.  A hidden gem, perched amid the rolling foothills of the Barossa Ranges, our guest house offers a blend of vintage charm and modern elegance. Whether it's a romantic weekend, a wine lover's escape, or a rejuvenating break with friends, we invite you to write your next chapter with us.
neighborhood_overview: Historical Preservation neighbourhood.
host_about:
Hello and a warm welcome to Isadore House!

After transforming the property, we’ve created a haven from our busy lives—a secret spot that we've cherished for some time. Now, we're thrilled to open the doors and share this tranquil retreat with you. 

Isadore House has been a personal escape for us, and we've poured our hearts into creating a space where you can unwind, relax, and make your own cherished memories. 

Enjoy your stay!

Anna

Emma & Roger

name: Modern Tranquility in the heart of Tanunda
description: Escape to the heart of the world-class Barossa Valley at our idyllic retreat in Tanunda. Our family-friendly home is just a short stroll from cafes, restaurants, historic sites, and the best wines the region has to offer. Relax and unwind in style with all the comforts of home. Book your stay and experience the charm of the Barossa Valley.
neighborhood_overview:
Location:
Tanunda is situated in the heart of the Barossa Valley, one of Australia's most renowned wine regions. The town is surrounded by vineyards and rolling hills, creating a scenic and peaceful environment.

Community Atmosphere:
The community in Tanunda is known for its friendly and welcoming atmosphere. It has a mix of residents, including locals who have been in the area for generations and newcomers attracted by the beauty of the region.

Historical Charm:
Tanunda has a strong German heritage, and this is reflected in its architecture and cultural events. Historic buildings, charming cottages, and tree-lined streets contribute to the town's character.

Vineyards and Wineries:
The Barossa Valley is famous for its vineyards and wineries, and Tanunda is no exception. Residents and visitors alike can enjoy exploring the numerous cellar doors, tasting world-class wines, and attending events celebrating the local viticulture.

name: Shady acres.
description:
This fully furnished,self-contained, stand alone, two bedrooms plus sofa bed, guest unit is nestled on ten acres. It is private, well off the main road, pet friendly with private backyard.

The main house is 200m away.

Yards for horses are opposite the unit. Dressage arena and 650m track are available.

Close by trail riding, cycling/ walking paths, historical townships (Gawler, Two Wells).

Barossa Valley is 25km away.

Come enjoy peace and quiet, whilst being close to amenities.
