name: Petit Manor
description:
NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN
Petit Manor is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley on 50 picturesque acres of land with rolling farmland, trees and hills. Perfect for a romantic getaway, the tiny house is set in a scenic location surrounded by alpacas and provides a pleasing blend of modern conveniences in a tranquil setting. It has one bedroom with a queen size bed, a small kitchen and lounge area, it also has a deck and verandah that you can enjoy any time of day. approx 1 hour from city
neighborhood_overview: We are approx 5 mins from Birdwood where you will find a supermarket, pub, bakery, takeaway and other small shops.  We are located approx 1 hour from the city and half an hour to Tanunda, approx 20 mins to Woodside. Sites to see are Gumeracha Rocking Horse, Lavender Farm, Whispering Wall, Hiking trails, nature walks, Warren reservoir where you can hire kayaks, Birdwood Motor Museum and lots of wineries.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

name: Abbotsford Country House - Magnificent Views
description:
A spacious and serene location in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Majestic views across the vineyards and rolling hills.
This property is newly listed as an ideal corporate function centre with 12 large bedrooms, 9 with ensuites, a huge reconfigurable conference room which can seat up to 20 around the conference table. The large dining room adjacent to the fully optioned kitchen can cater for up to 24 guests.
The extensive lawn areas mean that it is also well suited as a wedding venue.

name: Tanunda Central Cottage
description:
Welcome to our charming cottage in the heart of Tanunda Main Street, Barossa Valley. This recently renovated property has been beautifully restored and offers a comfortable and stylish stay in one of South Australia's most sought-after destinations.

Originally built in 1856, the cottage formed part of the original pharmacy in Tanunda. Today, it is a cozy two-bedroom retreat with all the modern amenities you need for a memorable stay.
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is a town in the Barossa Valley region of South Australia, and it is known for its wineries and German heritage. The neighborhood is characterized by quaint, historic buildings and tree-lined streets. It has a population of around 4,000 people and offers a range of amenities, including shops, restaurants, and parks.

name: No 19. The Reservoir Cottage
description:
The cottage is an historic sandstone building, built in 1879.
The property is in a calm & tranquil location, set in 2.5 hectares of land, with views facing the reservoir in the 'Pine Reserves'. Originally built for the reservoir manager, the reservoir used to supply all the water to Australia's oldest mining town, Kapunda. Located in the Barossa Valley, 15 minute drive to the nearest winery, 45 mins to Clare Valley. Maggie Beer Farm shop 20 mins drive, golf course near, pool in town.
neighborhood_overview: Kapunda is famous as the oldest mining town in Australia. The drive to Kapunda is beautiful, lots of little towns  to visit, there are cycling trails to explore,  a golf course,  trotting (horses) park. The Pines Reserve is great for walking and wildlife, echidnas, kangaroos, budgies, etc.   The town has the main essentials, and a great Foodland, for all necessary supplies.  Located between Clare Valley and Barossa it ideal for exploring both wine regions. ( You can hire affordable tour buses with drivers) .

name: Mrs Magpie's Cottage
description:
Welcome to Mrs Magpie's Cottage - a cosy nest enveloped in character and charm, situated in the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Perfect for a romantic escape, a family holiday or a girls' (or blokes') wine weekend.

Soak in the views of the surrounding hills as you enjoy a coffee or a glass of wine on the front porch. Sleeping up to five guests, Mrs Magpie's is the perfect base for you to explore the many wineries and charming historic towns in the Barossa Valley. Enjoy!
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by vines dripping with grapes and rolling hills, the charming small town of Lyndoch is Mrs Magpie's home. Stroll to the local pub, The Lord Lyndoch boutique restaurant, The Ministry of Beer (Brewery Cellar Door), cafe and bakery. A country market in the town's institute is held on the second Saturday of each month featuring homemade goods and quirky treasures. Weave your way to Tanunda (only 10-15 minute drive away) past gorgeous vineyards and welcoming cellar doors.
Enjoy the peace and tranquillity of Lyndoch with everything the Barossa boasts at your fingertips.
host_about:
I love to laugh, eat potato chips, do yoga and write romance/mystery novels...not all at once of course! Though wouldn't that be hilarious! 

I am fastidiously clean but not OCD...potato chips are messy you know!!
And I value honesty and integrity above all else. 
Amy x

name: The Rusty Lux Retreat
description: Rustic charm meets luxury feels. This private retreat is situated on the Main Street of Barossa's historic town of Angaston. Providing you with both convenience and comfort you can relax and enjoy exploring the Barossa knowing you have an inviting calm & clean place to rest in-between. We also offer exclusive private access to the modern pool between the hours of 3pm-6pm. The Rusty Lux is fully air-conditioned and heated, this b+b is perfect for your next Barossa get away! Please come and Enjoy.

name: Milk + Honey House, by Angaston
description: This unique, self-contained heritage cottage is fully renovated with modern conveniences for a comfortable stay. Featuring 2 spacious queen bedrooms, a generous kitchen dining area, lounge room & undercover outdoor dining area. The large bathroom features a bath & separate shower. An additional powder room area has a toilet & laundry.  Walking distance to Angaston, close to many Barossa attractions including iconic Vintners Bar & Grill and the Saturday morning Barossa Farmers Market.

name: The Residence at Schubert Estate
description: Available on a 'whole of house' basis, The Residence is a beautifully restored three bedroom heritage villa located in the Barossa Valley. The self-contained property features three king size bedrooms (two with en-suite), a full equipped kitchen, guest bathroom, dining room, dedicated workspace, lounge and laundry. Surrounded by gardens and estate vineyards, the property is located adjacent the Schubert Estate Wine Room where Residence guests enjoy a complementary tasting.
neighborhood_overview: The Residence is a 5 - 10 minute drive to nearby wineries including Torbreck, Greenock Creek, Two Hands and Seppeltsfield, and restaurants such as Appellation, Contours, Fino, Artisans of Barossa, Fermentasian and Hentley Farm. A complementary EV charging station and high speed internet is available on site for guest use.

name: The winemakers quarters
description:
Couples or families can relax in style at our renovated 1960's quintessentially Barossa holiday home. Hosted by the winemaker at Shrieking Witch Wines, our little home is centrally located, cosy, quiet with a fabulous backyard and orchard.
3 minutes walk to a brewery, 3 minutes walk to the best bakery and a 15 minute stroll to the centre of town means you will hardly even need your car!
Order wines ahead at 'shriekingwitchwines' website and they will be waiting for you at check-in.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and peaceful street, close to town.
host_about:
Hi I'm Nigel, the owner and winemaker of Shrieking Witch Wines. Our tiny family business based in Gawler East the far south west Barossa. We have our Montepulciano vineyard, Chickens, vege garden and fruit trees there.
Our wines are all single vineyard-small batch high quality wines from the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. We know you'll love to stay at our 'winemakers quarters' and you can order ahead to have a bottle or two ready for your stay!

Emma & Roger

name: Horse Side Farm Stay
description:
Experience the unhurried backcountry retreat at Horse Side Farm Stay! The ideal farm stay South Australia escape nestled in wide-open spaces, native birdlife, and farm animals (e.g., such as horses, sheep, and alpacas) to keep you company. An amazing piece of paradise, where you can take deep calming breaths and lazy afternoon naps in Kapunda. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that the tiny house is only a short distance from the main street, so you may hear passing vehicles on the property.
neighborhood_overview:
Horse Side Farm Stay sits in a small town near Barossa Valley in South Australia. Where you can explore restaurants, shops, and attractions for you to enjoy. So, make an endless list of things to do.

Our local recommendations:

- Pizza Bar and Takeaway serves a diverse selection of ingredients for dine-in and takeaway pizzas in town.
- One White Kite is a cafe that offers a delicious selection of pastries, light meals, coffee, and tea in Kapunda.
- Kapunda Mine Trail is a popular attraction that marks the first commercially copper metal mine in Australia.
- Kapunda Tourist Park is a camping and cabin accommodation set in a well-shaded park in Dutton Park, Kapunda.
- Whispering Wall is a popular attraction where "whispered words" can be heard 140 meters away from the other end of the dam.

If you want to know more, you can check out "Things to Do near Kapunda."

name: Spacious 4 Bed Home on Vineyard In Barossa Valley
description: Situated on a 13 hectare vineyard, this 4 bed home has reverse-cycle aircon and indoor and outdoor lounge areas. There’s a lovely garden with peach and lemon trees for you to pick in season. It’s 3 minutes drive to eateries and a supermarket, with a bigger selection at nearby Tanunda. Maggie Beer’s Farm shop is 2 minutes away offering a cafe, restaurant or cooking classes. Coullthard Reserve has family friendly picnic areas. And of course, there are endless wineries in the region to choose from.
neighborhood_overview: Located an hour’s drive from Adelaide, Nuriootpa is in the heart of the Barossa, famous for its world class wines and also home to some of the best culinary experiences in the region. It’s just a few minutes’ drive from the house to the town centre, where you can start your day with a coffee at the Fleur Social café before taking a stroll down the historic main street and exploring boutique shops. There’s a local Foodworks supermarket there too, or its less than 10 minutes’ drive to the Barossa Farmer’s Market in Angaston, open every Saturday morning. Indulge your sweet tooth at Linke's Bakery in Nuriootpa, or taste craft spirits infused with local botanicals at the Barossa Distilling Company’s rustic tasting room and bar. It’s also only a couple of minutes’ drive from the house to Maggie Beer’s Farm shop, where you can dine at The Eatery, purchase wines or take part in a cooking class. Coullthard Reserve is 5 minutes away by car, providing family friendly picnic areas, BBQ facilities,
host_about:
Hey I’m Mark!

After an extensive, colorful career performing on stage and in film/TV, I developed people skills which I love to utilize as a property host. People consider me to be a genuinely warm, polite and friendly person. 

I certainly love helping travelers enjoy their time here. My yardstick is treating
guests the way I like to be treated when I’m away from home. I work for MaisonNets, a boutique agency specializing in short-term rental management. The MaisonNets portfolio has over 125 properties, encompassing mid-range to luxury apartments and houses in Australia’s capital cities, as well as country homes and a villa in Bali. 

Our properties are all specifically selected for their amenities and prime location - the accommodation of choice for urban sophisticates, professionals, couples and families looking for a uniquely comfortable experience. 

With a focus on organic products, MaisonNets offers unparalleled personal service and attention to detail ensuring that you, our valued guest, have a wonderful stay with us.

name: Barossa Retreat among the Gums
description:
Our lovingy renovated stone home, has stood proud for over 150 years. Enjoy the character, charm & space; from the solid stone walls to vintage architectural details.
This is a truly special retreat for guests seeking a unique blend of history, art, and nature.
Set amid stunning natural surroundings, it's perfect for a rejuvenating getaway. The veranda is perfect for entertaining or a relaxing wine.
A unique property allowing for intimate getaways, family reunions, or a peaceful solo retreat.
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm an artist and business owner living  in the Barossa Valley. I love characterful houses, homes and hospitality and I have  three accommodations available in South Australia.
I have a weakness for beautiful stone homes typical to South Australia, that have a European feel. I appreciate natural light, wooden floorboards, enhancing architectural features and preserving what works from the past whilst adding charm and modern comforts. I like my guests to feel they have a stylish home away from home. 
My renovations style is comfy French provincial with a touch of vintage and original artworks on the walls for a restful and inspiring stay.
I travel a lot myself so I appreciate what it is to arrive to a place that feels like you can kick your shoes off, pour a wine and relax.

name: Retreat Bungalow in Barossa
description: Relax in this unique and tranquil retreat.
host_about:
Hello ,

We are a family who have been running Airbnb’s since 2017. We love it and are very interested to expand it.

Aloe has just published her first book on the accommodation businesses. Aloe has published numerous other books on various topics and always loves to make our guests happy.

Aloe’s partner Nick is a saxophonist who has worked as a professional Musican for 25 years and now helps to manage our Airbnb’s as well.  Nick can be a bit talkative.

Sherry is an accountant and works on financial and cleaning projects.  She will be very helpful if you need anything.

Sherry’s partner works on maintenance projects and he also is  a good cook. He has a warm kind soul.

Lia is our cleaner and she loves her job very much!

Lia’s partner Jack is taking care of the properties and helping Sarah to get the cleaning done.

We all love to be hosts and we use Airbnb all the time when we’re traveling.

Nice to meet you here!

name: Barossa,  French style
description:
Welcome to CIEL House, a beautiful peaceful property in the heart of Barossa surrounded by some of Australia’s best wineries. This gorgeous modern French style home is set on 7 acres; the perfect country vacay to relax and unwind.

With being located in the centre of the towns, it’s only a short drive to Angaston, Tanunda and Nuriootpa.
neighborhood_overview:
Barossa farmers market is just a short walk/drive from the house, open every Saturday morning from 7.30am- delicious local produce; it’s a must see!

The Barossa we are so lucky to be surrounded by some of the best wineries in the world- David Franz, Seppeltsfield, St Hugo, Chateau Tanunda, Ollins, Grenock Creek, Standis, Rusdin, Torbrek, Rockford, Henschke, Two Hands, Tom Foolery.. just to name a few!

If you aren’t just here for the wine, we have a few great breweries and two gin distilleries.

Barossa isn’t just about great wines, we also are lovers of food.. as they say, food and wine go hand in hand.
Hentley farm, FermentAsian, Harvest Kitchen, Fino, Contour at The Louise, Vitners, Vino Lokal

Barossa 1900 offers luxury vineyard accommodation for 10 people in the Barossa Valley, one hour’s drive from Adelaide.

The private two-acre property is home to some of the Barossa’s oldest dry-grown Grenache grapes and is located a short walk to cellar doors, restaurants, breweries and retail shopping in Tanunda.

Two-storey accommodation offers stunning views of the vineyard estate and landscape. There are generous inclusions for two-night stays and private winemaker tastings by appointment.

name: The Kirche - Luxury Couples Accommodation
description:
Situated on beautiful Krondorf Road, only three minutes from Tanunda, The Kirche offers a tranquil setting for either a long term or short term stay in the famous Barossa Valley.

This unique, historical building has been tastefully turned it into superb luxury vineyard accommodation without compromising the wonderful warmth and space evident in its origins.

Kirche is German for church. “The Zum Kripplein Christi” Lutheran Church was the centre of village life from 1864 through to the 1950’s.
